If you are looking for good Spanish food with friendly staff, then I highly recommend El Mediterrano.

column7: Definitely the best restaurant in the Jhamshikhel area
column8: We have been in Kathmandu for more than a year and live only a five minute walk from the restaurant -- but have somehow overlooked it until now. Regret not visiting earlier as this is definitely the best place in the area. Very good tapas (recommend the Patata Bomba) and while we planned to order main courses, ended up simply odering numerous tapas. Good wine options also make this a great place for dinner.

column7: Great place to be. Must visit
column8: Great food and great friendly people. Owner Bibhushan is just awesome person you would like to interact and know interesting facts about food..

Excellent, Truly Unbelievable in the middle of Nepal!! We could not believe how fresh and authentic this little Spanish restaurant is. We had the Tapas tasting menu, 12 courses to be precise. This was so fresh and tasty and the waiter new how long to give us between courses. My husband and I have eaten quite a lot of tapas over our time, not just in Spain but in other countries too and Le Mediterraneo will take some beating. The quality served to us was quite incredible. The Sangria must have been one of the best we have ever had (take note Spain with your on tap sangria!!!). What a fantastic gem of a place. I do hope travellers take some time out to eat here.

A colleague recommended we drop by for the great paella. When it turns out that the paella took a while to make, we opted for the pasta.  It was delicious. So not the Spanish food that we had anticipated, but still an enjoyable meal.  Service was attentive, food was great. The owner popped over and chatted to us; made sure that we were happy.  Again - a sure return visit.

Staying at this guesthouse was such an incredible experience. I LOVED the decor, the service, and the location. They do a really incredible job of keeping the space clean, while giving you a good taste of what the traditional Newari style is like. My room had a double bed, an eating area, a private bathroom, and a closet to. hand stuff up. I was nervous about the temperature (I live in Hawaii & the temperature was in the 40's EEK!), but the warm blankets they provided were more than enough. The breakfast they served gave a good variety of foods and had as much tea as you could drink! I sat in one of the window frames looking out on the courtyard. It had. posts on either side that show the beautiful characteristics of the traditional wood carvings. The staff. was

column7: A vivid reminder of the culture and architecture that is disappearing in Nepal
column8: Drop in for a visit even if you don't stay here, to appreciate what Newari culture has been for the past centuries. The house is impeccably restored (with UNESCO support) and can only make one nostalgic for what has been lost in only a single lifetime. Unbeatable location between Mangal Bazaar and Kumbheswar/Baglamukhi temples, with a great staff, serves a good breakfast, too. Only 8 rooms (all different) so book early. Not particularly inexpensive but worth the price, and be warned, the outside street noise is loud.

column7: A two week trip to Nepal, staying in Patan.
column8: We were very happy staying in Traditional Homes. I had communicated with Punam on several occasions prior to our arrival and she was very efficient and quick to respond. All the staff were delightful and very friendly, as well as Punam the waiters in the Swotha Café were great and made a point of taking our order for breakfast the evening before we had to make an early departure. Our room was simple but delightful and comfortable, the shower room was small but there was masses of hot water. I think our rooms might have been the smallest and were several floors up, the staircase was quite steep and narrow which didn’t worry us but it might be good to check where your room will be if the stairs concern you. There was no headboard as there was a low shelf that ran along the

A great place to stay. You will feel like a home. They very welcoming. Highly recommending.Their breakfast is amazing.You will get the best in a very low budget. There is lots to see near the hotel also.

column7: A great long-term or short-term stay in Patan or Kathmandu!
column8: I was in Nepal for a work trip, and I stayed at Tajaa Pha for approximately four months. It was an excellent place to stay! Shilandra and his family were extremely hospitable. As a solo traveler, I felt like part of the family and very comfortable at the Tajaa Pha. My laundry was promptly returned every week, and a great breakfast was always available if I did not feel like cooking that day. The home is centrally located to Patan - close to Patan Durbar Square, many other Newari heritage sites, and only a short taxi ride away from central Kathmandu. This is a must stay location if you are in Patan or want to escape hectic Thamel. The view from the top floor is great; it provides the best view of Patan and the mountains on a clear day.

Boutique heritage home is a home away from home.i spent 4 nights there and could not be any happier.First,the hotel is very conveniently located, walking distance to the center of patan, patan durbar square and with very easy transportation to Kathmandu, and the airport and is close to all major attractions. The hotel is a newly decorated,very well kept old hotel that has been running for years.It is phenomenal and offers you a taste of an authentic Nepali hotel,with a great history with all the bonuses of a hip and modern hotel. The place is sparkling clean,modern,cozy ,safe and accommodating. It offers great nights of sleep!! There is hot water at any time , as well as electricity and super fast WiFi ( all of which could be a problem in Nepal). What makes this place even more

column7: Excellent property excellent staff and service
column8: This is an outstanding property where the hotel is very close to main attractions. Initially we booked bamboo suit. Room was very spacious and equipped with all the amenities we could think of. I must mention about staff of the hotel. Staff’s are very generous respectful and polite. One of the best services we have seen so far. They were trying to accommodate all our requests and went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. We were delighted to have the opportunity to choose different locations for our morning breakfast. Fascinating. We were very impressed and delighted with our initial two night stay; therefore we booked another 7 nights. Overall experience was excellent. Kudos to Timila management and staff.

column7: Great food, slow service, lovely atmosphere
column8: The food here was really great and plenty of choice. The cafe is far enough off the main street to be nice and quiet and they have planted a nice garden and potted plants around the place to make for a great atmosphere. Service was slow but polite.

column7: Hidden gem providing excellent Newari food
column8: We stayed in Patan during our time in Kathmandu and this was a place my wife discovered after some research. We were surprised it wasn't in any of the guide books we saw (rough guide / lonely planet) as it is probably the best place we visited for a taste of local Newari food.  The location is behind a main road (about 10-15 mins walk from Patan Durbar square) and quite lovely, with a lot of the noise and dust of Kathmandu seemingly cut out, and the atmosphere is laid back and non-rushed. The restaurant was founded by a group who encourage and support employment of local women to work and earn money, where they otherwise would not be able to. The staff were very attentive and happy to explain all aspects of the local food and dishes they offered. While we are not experts we had tried other examples of Newari food and this was definitely the best we tried; it was obvious that the dishes were made with care and love.  Thumbs up.

column7: Nice and quiet place to have a special Newari cuisine
column8: I have been to the Village Cafe and really enjoyed the private garden, quiet and with beautiful flowers. The staff is welcoming and I had the opportunity to have a special newari food and especially the yomaree! This Cafe is only managed by women and they welcome us to see how to they make the special dishes. We can find next to this cafe a handicrafts shops displaying the work from different SAARC countries and related to the decoration of the cafe! (pillow, ceramics cup). Above all the Village cafe offers organic foods and coffee!

Tucked away in Vesper's is a large wine shop. The food is good and the service friendly and attentive. What would make me come back is the access to quality and breadth of wine, which is not always so common in Kathmandu.

column7: Is this the same restaurant as in the reviews?
column8: It's been a year since the last time I swore I'd never return again. But it was a bunch of friends, and I was swept away in the tides of peer pressure.  Surely, I thought, now they've taken the last year to tighten up their service so food comes out at the same time -- or that food comes out, period! Surely, their waiters will be more present. Surely, their bar service will be more on point.  Oh well.  It was a Saturday night, moderately busy, but plenty of waitstaff in front of house. Got seated promptly with menus, but that was the last I saw of anything resembling decent service.  I got excited about wine list. No one came to take an order, so after 15 minutes or so, I walked around the dining room until I could coax a waiter over to the table. I ordered some wine and food.  Twenty minutes later, no drinks yet. Used the bathroom. A stark contrast to the elegant open air dining room, the WC had all the ambience of a truck stop.  Another 10 minutes pass. A waiter comes to tell me (a different waiter, every time) about how they don't have that wine. Or that other wine I wanted. Or the other one. I ask him to tell me about the wines they *do* have. A few high end imports, well beyond what I originally intended to spend. Order their lackluster house wine instead (the one my corner bodega sells for 1/4 of the price). At least they had that. No one else at this point had received drinks either, not even water.  At last, my food arrived. All of it at once, app and main. One full hour later (seriously) my friend's food arrives. Some late joiners received their food much later still.  As for the quality of the food, I just don't get it, people! I mean, yes, we live in Kathmandu, not NYC or Paris or Singapore. I do get that. Managed expectations and all that. But the wings were non-offensive at best, and the pizza? Meh. The thin crust was soggy and bland, the ingredients tasted previously frozen. There is better pizza to be had in this town, three minutes walking to Roadhouse, to be specific. Not sure why so many reviewers are backflipping about Vesper food.  The final spectacle: separate checks. Holy cow. You'd think we'd asked for their firstborn child. So much resentment. But c'mon, people come to your restaurant precisely because you can support medium to large parties. Why you hating?  That's fine. I won't return anywhere I'm not wanted. At least not for another year.

Been taking large groups to the restaurant for over a year now and the service and food is always fantastic. We normally make reservations for evening meals with large groups but they always manage to accommodate us and take care of everyone in the group. All the food here is very fresh and cooked to order with a large selection of western fare.

I was transported back to Napa Valley one evening when invited to dine here! Refreshing drinks in an al fresco setting which was essentially indoors! We both opted for pork roast! Came with creamy mashed potatoes and medley of spring vegetables! Mmmm delicious!  And yes, California standard washrooms- spacious, clean and bright, dry and modern! Most memorable meal so far!
Fantastic location with delicious food and a relaxing ambience make this the number one restaurant in Kathmandu

column7: Relaxed, nice lighting, good food. A European style bubble....
column8: This is the nicest ambiance and best pizza/pasta I have found in Nepal.The wine is decent which means one glass costs about the same as a dish but for a treat with a friend this is the place for me. Its like stepping into a relaxed and easy European bubble for an hour or two, and off the streets of Kathmandu sometimes I need that.

column7: Expensive and Pathetic Food and Service!!!
column8: I remember going to this restaurant with one of my mates last May. As soon as we walked in we were seated in the courtyard and given a menu to order food and beverages. Coming from Australia things don't seem very as expensive here but when I dined in this restaurant my thoughts were changed. My mate and myself orders beers, chicken chilli and a pasta. To my surprise when our order was served I found no cheese topped on the pasta which was quite unusual and the chicken chilli served had more cheap veggies than chicken and was served cold. I asked the waiter if he could bring me some cheese to sprinkle on the pasta I had ordered. So he did (which I assumed would be a complimentary). But to my absolute surprise while going though the bill I discovered that I was charged NPR160+23%TAX for the parmesan cheese which was just a pinch in a small bowl, which I initially thought was complimentary. Pasta was NPR370+23%TAX & beer was NPR450+23%TAX. I wish I had retained the receipt with me so that I could upload on TripAdvisor. Also food here is very very very expensive and is not affordable by everyone. It is just meant for the people coming from overseas, people who make big bucks. I would highly suggest anyone thinking of going to this restaurant in the near future to reconsider your decision and plan elsewhere. One of the worst restaurant I have dined in Kathmandu.

I went to Vesper for an early dinner with friends and our small children: two toddlers and one infant. All the Italian food and the seafood appetizer we ordered was very tasty and reasonably priced, although the fish and chips was just average.  The Vesper House is now serving the full restaurant menu after the old Cafe building was destroyed, and they have expanded the space to accommodate more people. It is a nice, modern, clean space with plenty of room, although i hope they add a "play" room for little ones like the old building had to make it more family friendly.  The service was very friendly and the staff accommodated us and the children. However, a staff member should return to the table after the food has been served to check, and also ask if we want our bill or dessert after the meal. Each time I've eaten at Vesper (both old and new) it's taken forever to ask for and get the bill.  Overall the food is very good in comparison with many other restaurants in the area, and the facilities are great.

They have upgraded not only their interiors and restaurant design, including al fresco dining at any time, but also their menu selection. We always go for the Smoked Chicken Jalapeno Pizza whether dine in or take out, our family added to the favorite list: Grilled Herb Chicken, Rissoto Funghi, Chicken Salad (with fresh greens). We feast tasting and sharing each dish and all the texture and flavours just blend in the mouth. We also appreciate the owner, Gagan, who is always welcoming and with arms open wide every time he sees us. The best place to chill on a Friday night, especially. Oh, and one of our favorite areas? The rest room! Fresh flowers everyday, nice smelling, clean, and filled with music. While waiting for the food to be served, my husband and I get to enjoy our "we-time" while our children play in the children's play room. Nice!!!

column7: It's ok, but is that enough?
column8: In the past 10 days of staying in Patan I feel like I've been around the block a few - in terms of restaurants. Tonight I decided to try Vesper's and was thrilled to see Mulled Wine available as it was a cool evening. So I ordered a mulled wine, plain soda and a pepperoni pizza with mushrooms and a side of pesto. I was simply shocked to see "pepperoni" so I had to try it. I sat by a heater inside and read my book peacefully, sipping the mulled wine, which was overly fragrant (I tried to take a deep breath before I took a drink). I actually loved the flavor of the wine, but wasn't too keen on the spices floating in the wine, i.e. couldn't that be strained off prior to serving? The pizza arrived and I was famished so I inhaled 2 slices without even really taking a moment to make a decision on whether I actually liked it. And ultimately my conclusion was - meh. Something about it just didn't taste right. Maybe it's the cheese, maybe the sauce...crust was alright. But hey I've been living near NYC for nearly 13 years and before that Italy, so what was I expecting. If I went back - though I doubt I will in the next 10 days I'll be here - I'd probably give pasta or risotto a shot.

column7: Great value, food and fire heaters!!
column8: I am a big fan of Vesper's food and wine. Every time I visit Kathmandu, I make a point to stop by no matter how short my trip is. My friends and I went for dinner and drinks. Each time I go to Vesper, theres always have something new going on. Like this time it was the skylight glass roof in the outdoor area. It looked amazing. I had the guacamole and sprout toastas- it was one of their specials and and my friends had german sausage with baby potatoes. We all thought the food was really delicious. We also opened a bottle of wine too. Last but not least we ended with swedish chocolate balls for dessert. We really had a divine time.Thank you Vesper.

Don't get me wrong, Vesper Cafe serves decent (though overpriced) food. But nothing to justify the tag of "best food in Patan/Lalitpur" that seems bestowed on it here. For example, in my last meal there, I ordered a Beef Tenderloin with Pink Peppercorn sauce - which was just a standard steak available anywhere in the world, and a Sangria which they served with "ICE" in it! Don't get me started me on the mosquitoes in the courtyard too (and for which there were no mosquito coils/citronella spray around). Eat at Vesper if you are nearby, don't make it a destination!

column7: Whenever you need to relax from the noisy Thamel...
column8: I've been there twice with Nepali friends, and I plan to come back again when in Nepal... Quiet relaxing place, good food, good music, the garden is particularly nice in the evening... And they make the best pizza in Nepal!

column7: after six months, a new visit to The Vesper Café
column8: After six months, I came back to Nepal and I visited the Vesper café and restaurant for lunch. It is a wonderful place to forget the noisy and polluted life of Kathmandu. An interior garden will welcome you with flower and music (the owner is a lover of jazz music) in a ambiance that fusioned eupean and nepali style. A wonderful pizza (the best of Nepal!) and other italian dishes are waiting for you. Alongsiude the Vesper café and restaurant, you can find the Vesper wine house, a real "cave à vin" in Nepal, with italian and french wines of the top quality! If you visit Nepal, you cannot miss a visit to this restaurant and wine house!

column7: Great Wine and Food excellent atmosphere
column8: I find vesper cafe for coincidence during my trip in Katmandu and immediately i get a nice hospitality, and warm welcome. We have a dinner with our friends start with a nice glass of Vesper house wines from Italy Orvieto, we sharing a nice pasta e pizza make in the real traditional oven great experience we really surprise for a quality of food and wines and reasonable price. We back again in the last 3 days we stay Katmandu excellent place.

column7: Best restaurant in Patan/Kathmandu, from far !
column8: Such a cosy place !  We had our 1st wedding anniversary there, it was more than perfect.  You should definately go for a special occasion, or only because you feel like having a nice evening, apart from the busy Kathmandu.  For wine lovers, there is a great cellar ! So good to taste european wines - at the right temperature. We also had the best fresh lime mint we ever had : it almost felt like a mojito without alcohol.  We had nice pizzas, but we didn't try the other meals (except an amazing cheese plate to go along with the wine...).  The service is very attentive to any special need, the place is really clean - definitly deserved the 1st rank.
Great food, service and wines. This is the place to go for reliable quality and dining. Big plus for the very friendly owners! After three months in Nepal, this is the place to go to 6 days out of 7.

On a cold winter evening it's indulge in either coffee, wine or Champagne.  It’s all change up since a few months ago. Gone is the slightly dishevelled bar now it's a mix of an elegant dining surroundings and a café style which makes for a more informal setting, with a great fire place.  The food is fab, as is the service efficient.  One of the best places to spend an evening in Kathamandu

A beautiful place, for Nepal, but dusty because the streets look like a war zone of construction and the whole of Paten is covered with rubble and dust. The food is good but very expensive. For a poor country why is Nepal so expensive. Nothing...More
Whenever I'm in town I make a point of eating here at least once. For good food and service in pleasant surroundings, look no further. They make a pretty mean mojito too.

Krishna Ashtami!!  The birthday of Lord Krishna is celebrated as Krishn Ashtami. Krishna, the dark- skinned god revered as a manifestation of Lord Vishnu, who taught warrior Arjuna the value of Karma in the Bhagwad Gita, was born at midnight on the eighth day of the dark moon of August which is known as ashtami.. To celebrate the birthday of this popular Hindu god, devotees flock to Krishna temples all over Nepal; Kathmandu Valley's Krishna Mandir in Patan Durbar Square is the centere of celebrations and is thronged by a large number of devotees who gather at night to pay homage beyond mid-night. Even during the day, hordes of devotees visit the temple to pray and make offerings. t night, men and women from far and wide gather in and around the 17th century stone temple singing praises of Lord Krishna waiting for the midnight hour. Euphoric prayers and incantations fill the air, and small oil lamps are lit as a mark of felicitation and devotion to the god. Images of Lord Krishna are also carried around the city in processions accompanied by joyous crowds of followers and musical troupes. Along the lanes of old Kathmandu people display framed pictures of Krishna showing various episodes of his amazing life.

Built in the 17 century the temple has survived numerous earthquakes and hold a commanding position in the Durbar square of Patan. Most of the important scenes from the ancient epics of Ramayana and Mahabharata are engraved on it.

On 5th Nov we visited a stone wrought monument in sikhar style architecture, Krishnamandir built by King Siddhi Narsimha Malla of Patan in 1637 when he dreamt that Lord Krishna and Radha were standing in front of his palace . On the same spot , at the centre of the Darbar Chowk he built the temple .  It had three floors and twentyone pinnacles . The first floor enshrined Lord Krishna with Radha and Rukmini beautifully carved out in black stone . The floor had illustrations of ten incarnations of lord Vishnu . Important Mahabharat events were carved on a beam of this floor . Shiva ling was on second floor . The third floor was empty . It was said , earlier there was an idol of Avalokitesvara .The interior of the temple depicted the scenes from the Ramayana narrated in Newari script .  Beware of the narrow steps to the first floor of the temple , which were the cause to hit my head while climbing down the stairs .  We appreciated an Oriental model posing in front of the temple .
when visiting Patan it is hard to miss this temple. Make sure to catch it while there- take in all the history and the significance- this will be sure to catch your ey

Shikara style temple dedicated to lord krishna , the suprim god of the great epics Mahabharata. Temple look like a mountain with 21 pinnacle, whole temple was build from stone with beautiful carving. One of the specialty of this temple is the whole story of Mahabharata epics was carved around the temple. The temple was build at the time of Malla dynastic around 14th century. Temple is still live due to special worshiping program every day.
If you believe in Lord Krishna, you have to visit this place! It is peaceful and a delight for architecture lovers! Make sure you visit the temple in time for morning puja and evening aarati!

The temple is completely covered in scaffolding and there is a fence around it. It looks pretty intact from the outside and on the day I was there there were a lot of Hiindu's inside it. The temple is built of stone blocks, ighly carved and is on 3 teirs. It is built in the Moghul style and is really different from the rest of the temples here. It is, so I am told, very popular and can get quite crowded. I walked around it but did not go in - was not sure how safe it was!!

We visited this during our Nepal trip in December 2010.Shikhara style architecture of this temple is amazing. This is the most important temple in Patan Durbar Square.It is built using the Shikhara architecture style imported from India and not the Pagoda style popular in Nepal. The stone carvings on the beam above the first and second floor pillar is most notable. The first floor pillar carvings tell the events of the Mahabharata while on the second floor there are visual carvings from Ramayana. Worth a visit when in Kathmandu area.
Different than original Nepalese style temple, this Krishna temple has 21 pinnacle. It is 3 storied temple with mahadev, radha & Krishna, and budhha in three different floors.
This temple built in Indian style adorns the Durbar Square at Patan. The carvings are exquisite. One can visit the first floor. A must visit place at Patan

in this mandir the original shape od the indian classical shikara has been modified . in this elegant three floors building the slim pillars give an air of lightness to the gray stone. the decoration is sober and enhances the game of shade and ligh of the porticos . during Krishna Astami,about the end of august ,the temple is surrounded by an immense ,colored crowd of devotees,offering flowers,fruits and religious chanting,a magic experience ,especially by night.

Beautiful and opportunity to know ancient Nepal. There are so many good things to see in and around this destination. It would be further beneficial if there is a local guide who knows more on the ancient culture, history and tradition of Nepal. Should you have any query or detailed requirement on how to make your trip most rewarding please do not hesitate to contact myself. I shall be more than pleased to assist you.

column7: One of the masterpiece of Shikhar style temple dedicated to lord Krishna
column8: Krishna mandir is situated in the Durbar square area of Patan. This temple was built by Malla King Sidhhinarsingha in 16th Century. This temple is considered as the masterpiece of Shikhar style temple in Nepal. It has 21 golden pinnacles and three storyed. Not a single nail or wood has been used to built it. The king saw Krishna and Radha standing infront of his palace. The temple is built exactly at the same place. There are carvings of pictorial taless of Mahabharata and Ramayana at 1st and 2nd floor of the temple. There is staute of king with a bird on his head in namaste posture on a pillar infront of the temple. It is said that the king before his death that he should not be thought dead until the bird on his head fly or the hands go apart from namaste posture. So, even today a room is made ready with clean bed and hookkah every night and the guard say they hear the sound of smoking hookka and find creases on the bed in the morning. A lot of pigeons at the courtyard outside the temple. You can feed them with maizes, paddy etc ( can be bought nearby) . It is believed that the air from pigeons wings is very useful. hurting pigeons here is punishible. It is one of the grand momuments in kathmandu valley. One must see it.

A lovely little restaurant to visit for great hummus and falafel. And to make it better, the owner is a lovely guy! If you can't make it to their restaurant, they also have a stand outside Labim Mall. I highly recommend a visit for delicious food at a reasonable price. I have been back several times!

column7: Why Taza is my favourite place in town
column8: I discovered Taza last year and it was probably the best thing I've discovered since I discovered Middle Eastern food (I love middle eastern food). The food has been consistently good since day 1. The location is fantastic and I dont think there's a better Maître D' than Basel in this entire town. Order the Taza Platter and make sure to get extra of that foodgasmic sauce.

First of all the guy who runs Taza is an amazing person and the food will be served with a smile. The food is delicious and make sure you are wearing a lose pair of clothes as you gonna feel tight after a belly full of middle eastern surprises, The aesthetics are splendid, murals-paintings are fabulous speaking about the famous places of Syria.

Sadly I only discovered Taza recently, otherwise I would have been here far more often in the last few years.  Food is middle Eastern style (hummus, falafel, grilled meat), but the setting is similar to a typical Nepali place - and these two styles blend very well. Food has been consistently excellent, with the chefs taking the time to respond to feedback (e.g. I prefer my bread warm, which has been noted by the staff and that's what I get now!). Menu has options for vegetarians, vegans and meat eaters, so everyone can find something to eat and enjoy. I think the price is completely reasonable and offers good value.  The owner is a lovely guy who takes the time to get to know his customers. I have no hesitation recommending Taza, and will be bringing friends/family to eat here in the future...

column7: GREAT authentic arabic food in Nepal!
column8: This spot guarantees a bit of Middle-Eastern flare. Due to the super good reviews any may carving for Falafel I just went there to check it out. It really doesn’t feel like you are in Nepal. The food is just fantastic and super fresh. I had the Veg Platter and a friend the Chicken Kebap and we agreed - both was great!! The prices are reasonable and the owner / chef are super nice and did a good service. I will definitely go there again!

column7: The best Middle Eastern food in Kathmandu
column8: I used to have to go to Or2K in Thamel when I felt like Middle Eastern food (Israeli), but Taza (Syrian) tops it! The vege plates--with hummus, baba ganoush, breads, falafel, etc--is delicious, and a perfect vegetarian choice. The staff/owners are friendly and always remember me when I come back. The location is convenient if you work and live in Patan, although it's on the busy Pulchowk Rd, so it's not the nicest location. But the food and service make up for that!

My family, another family, and a friend met up here for lunch based on some friends recommending it. It was a truly delightful find! The guys were friendly, and the food was delicious and quite inexpensive! We really enjoyed our lunch there a lot and will definitely be returning! All four of the kids dug in and ate a ton (which is rare with four little ones who are in varying moods at any given time). Oh, and they were quite fast with the food, which is always helpful when we're out with kids! We were all SO full from all the wonderful food (we ordered a LOT so that we could try and share a lot of dishes) and still walked away with a very reasonable price for a TON of food! I highly recommend this and can guarantee it will make it onto a regular rotation of places for us to eat!

column7: Ordered too much, ate it all, and ordered more -- extraordinary
column8: Tasneem's was a surprise find recommended by a friend of ours on a quick trip to Kathmandu, and it was incredible -- highly, highly recommend.  After cocktails (try the spicy whiskey one), we ordered the chicken mix and mutton mix platters to begin, and each was delicious... my favorites were the chicken tikka, the mutton kebab bites, and the melt-in-your-mouth cutlets. We then moved on to the chicken inquilab and the butter chicken, and both were great, though the butter chicken is an absolute must-order -- it's among the best dishes I've eaten, and is every bit the blend of spiced, spicy, rich, and tangy that you want it to be. It's flawless.  We were already stuffed but just... couldn't stop? We ordered another round of beers and naan, wiped the chicken dishes clean, and moved on to the gajjar ka halwa, which was a slow-cooked dessert made of carrots, milk, butter, raisins... it was an amazing end to a phenomenal meal.  I'd like to offer a balanced review, but frankly can't think of any critiques of this meal -- the food was stellar, the ambience and service were top-notch, and I'd seriously consider swinging through Kathmandu again soon just to revisit this menu. Five stars, and would give a sixth if I could.

column7: A real gourmet experience at Tasneem's
column8: I live in Bangkok and visited Kathmandu for four days at the end of August. I went to TKK on the recommendation of a friend. I am an Indian but I had to non-Indian friends with me. The experience was amazing, This is no ordinary run of mill Indian Tandoori restaurant. This place showcases Bohra cuisine with recipes passed down through generations. The complexity of flavors and the richness of the dishes showed the TLC put into the cooking. We focused on the kebabs accompanied by Gorkha beer. I have rarely tasted such tender meat. The mutton sigri and chicken cutlet melt in the mouth. The butter chicken is amazing as the gravy is the best that I have tasted. I had the Nihari which was also excellent but the biryani was already finished ( to my deep regret). The restaurant is in an old Nepali house and is spread over three levels. The place was full of groups of friends and family with a really fun vibe. Please go there with a big appetite but I bet you cannot help overeating. The service is amazing and try and get the real cool owners to talk about their food. It makes the food taste even better.

Great food. Portions aren't as generous as some other Indian restaurants in the area that we've gone to. And some menu options were also unavailable. They boast they make their own ice cream - yet it was unavailable when we were there! Nonetheless, the service is very friendly, and food very tasty.

column7: Quality time with a feel of home
column8: An authentic place for Indian style mouth watering delicious food. The ownwer/Chef oneself greeting will make you feel the presence of homely environment. I strongly recommend to all my family, friends.

column7: Family dinner at Tasmeen and we enjoyed every bit of it.
column8: We were tying to explore something new and then we found Tasneem's Kings Kitchen, and like the name say, they make u feel like a "King". If you are really looking for some authentic indian, pakistani or arabic flavor - this is the place. I was looking for some new taste, so tried "kasba" - for the first time and the food actually exceeded my expectation. The presentation was great, the flavor and taste was amazing, the ambience was super cool and the team was awesumest. The feeling I got was - made from the heart.  Value for money and enjoyed every bit of it.  Thank you team Tasneem for all your efforts

column7: The best Mumbai Indian and Bohra Muslim dishes
column8: I'm a regular here and keep coming back for the signature items on the menu. The celebrated Kasba is famous and unbeatable but my personal favourite is the Halim. It has been perfected and the dedication and tedious long hours of preparation of this dish is a salute to the place. I keep asking when it is being prepared (its is not a regular item on the menu) and make sure I call and book a plate of it and land there to relish this, Try the Halim and you will be hooked like me and many others who keep coming back for this amazing treat. Amazing on its own or can be accompanied by paratha or roti. Its so good that I schedule it on my appointment list as its something not to be missed.

column7: The Best Indian Restaurant in Kathmandu.
column8: The best Indian Restaurant with a blend of great food, amazing ppl who make them & an ambiance that take u to old school bollywood. Tasneems place is where we find the best of indian food in town. All my friends & colleagues from India & Nepal have our regular joint n thats TKK. Bless Tasneem Shahani who has devoted to share her culinary craft for Ktm dwellers who just cant get enough of her Biryanis & special treat including Kabsa. The only place in Ktm that can live upto the Paavbhaaji of mumbai; thank god they have delivery, lunch packets & catering services for corporates & group orders. If you love indian food & if you havent been to Tasneems; there s sth serious you re missing out on. Cheers

column7: Good food, great ambiance. Try the Kasba
column8: We went to Tasneem's Kings Kitchen for a office lunch. We ordered the Kasba and boy it was delicious. It was an all out meal in one. There were five of us and we still has food leftover that for each of us to take home. The restaurant owner Tasneem took time and made everything was in order for our meal. One of the best meals I've had in a long time. A bed of rice with an assortment of various kebabs and to top it all an entire leg of lamb so we'll marinated that meat was falling off the bone.. A must try. Highly recommend to try the kasba. Make sure you are in a group of at least 6. If not you can always order from the menu.

I found this gem of a place looking for halal eats in Kathmandu. I went here the first night i landed and i instantly fell in love with the food and vibe. Aunty Tasneem is one of the warmest kind hearted souls i have come across. I get so homesick when travelling and it seriously felt like having a mum away from home. I have come back every day for a meal or even two ! The food is such comfort food from the simple daals to the delicious biryanis. Except for sunday as its closed,but, yet Aunty Tas still went above and beyond to make me feel at home to organise a personal takeaway order for me on her day off. Her and the team are wonderful. Shes an angel in disguise, i will defs be returning to kathmandu over the years after having the best first experience. Thanks guys !!

I just had lunch at Tasneem’s and it was delicious. I stumbled across it as I was exploring this part of the city and the food was delicious. It is in a more upmarket part of the city and the prices reflect this but the quality of service, atmosphere, cleanliness and food were the best I’ve experienced in Kathmandu so far.

Being a foodie and an avid traveller I very rarely go to a restaurant twice. However Tasneem's was an exception. This a terrific joint for all Moglai and Bohri food made in a homely style. The cuisine is authentic and made with care. The restaurant does not have the flair of an avant grade chef but has the genuineness of an hostess who loves to serve her own creations in her tastefully decorated dining rooms. Kathmandu is extremely lucky to have this creative kitchen. A must visit for all foodies.

column7: Deserves more than a FIVE STAR!
column8: This one restaurant that certainly exceeded more than just five star. From start to finish this place deserves all the rave reviews and the 5 star rating. The warm welcome by all staff especially in what is my opinion the genuinely nicest restaurant owner Tasneem Shahani, will make you feel at home and ensure all your needs are catered for. The food has to be one of the best Indian spots to eat in Nepali. Their biryani and dal makhani especially are the best that I have ever had. This place is a must try and the best part is it's the MOST REASONABLY PRICED RESTAURANT, I have come across in the country. You can afford to eat here almost everyday, and yes you will never get bored with the food, I personally vouch for it.

column7: BIRYANI IS LOVE , cooked with love and served with warm hospitality.
column8: This is biryani lovers paradise. The food is awesome. Uniquely authentic and Bollywood sensation inside will get you feel like you are somewhere else on your vacation and get into the dancing mood. Definitely 5 STAR !! forget your hectic day, keep calm and dine...More

column7: Excellent Experience with Food, Ambiance and the Best of All the Personalized Service
column8: I am Consultant and a Trainer for Retail Outlet and QSR and Specialize in Customer Service living in Kathmandu. I should say the Dinner I had in Tasneem's on the 26th Dec 2017 was an amazing experience. Every Sunday they are closed for the Public, but this Sunday due to Christmas Eve and the Demand of their Clients they were open. Since they had opened on the Sunday they had declared that Tuesday would be closed. One of our friends not releasing that it was closed called the owner Tasneem to order their Famous Kabssa for the dinner that day. But was little disappointed that it was closed. Has my friend hung up the phone she got a call within 5 mins from Tasneem and confirming the order for the same night though they were closed.  We were altogether 10 of us. We reached the restaurant and were greeted by both Tasneem and Harsh her Husband and to our shock we released that they were the only one in the restaurant with one or two assistance. I was amazed with the Hospitality they had rendered and they had opened the restaurant just for us so that we would not be disappointed. Has we are seated to seats both of them come to us and apologies if there would be any goof up in the service since Tasneem and Harsh both were serving us. The drinks and Soft drinks come and then it was followed by the Famous Kabssa and Seriously my Jaw dropped down seeing this in Actual...OMG......This was is another 5 Star ..... This is a meat lovers paradise ...The whole Experience I should say is an Excellence of Service....My Five Star to you Tasneem & Harsh for a memorable Dinner we had…..Cheers to you Both!!!!  I should say to all the people Travelling to Kathmandu do drop by this Wonderful Restaurant and do meet the Tasneem and Harsh for sure. They would really make your day.

We visited this restaurant one evening during a recent trip to Patan.  In a city where the restaurants can be pretty daunting for most of us tourists, this one was excellent. The food was fresh, and the service excellent. Very helpful waiting staff who knew the menu well, could explain dishes, and make recommendations.  Would highly recommend the Butter Chicken curry  Location is central as it’s only 2 mins walk from the new shopping mall, but it is a little tucked away so you’ll need to watch out for it!

column7: Food or service, you'll not be disappointed
column8: The flavors, the taste, the ambience, the service and the old Bollywood movie vibes – this fusion is sure to make anyone become a regular customer at Tasneem’s Kings Kitchen. The food at TKK is absolutely spot on authenticity and healthy. It gives you feeling of food-orgasm: totally satisfying and worth paying for. I crave for chicken biryani, just like a baby craves for candies; I tried many restaurant for biryani and butter chicken and I end up here almost every time. I strongly recommend for everyone to pay visit at least one to enjoy the yummylicious food and great service.

When in Kathmandu recently, one of the highlights of my visit was the meal at Tasneem’s Kings Kitchen (TKK). It was also a reunion of sorts as when living in Kathmandu ten years ago, we were regulars of Tasneem’s home catering, food perfect for house parties – wholesome deliciousness with homey flavours. Tasneem had since then gone on to open her restaurant and my husband and I were keen to see the place and, of course, to meet Tasneem and her family – it had been exactly ten years since we saw them last. Twelve of us were booked for lunch at TKK and to be honest, we were wondering how the restaurant would manage, expecting a Mom and Pop operation. However, on reaching TKK, we were charmed by the lovely and well run restaurant created by Tasneem and her husband, Harshawardhan.  We were also delighted to find that the food served was as wholesome as we remembered from years ago but the flavours had been upped to pack a restaurant dining experience punch. Right from the aam panna and the jal jeera drinks that we ordered to the starters and the main meal to dessert – every thing was fabulous! As we were 12 of us with different preferences, we made our choices there and then, ordering off the menu, so it can be safely said that everyone else in the restaurant, too, was having the same quality of food that we were served.  Of special mention are the scrumptious Bohra Chicken Cutlets (nothing comes close to the ones served at TKK – even in Bombay which is known for this cutlet) with the mince succulent and a light coating of egg cooked just right; the innovative vegetarian seekh kabab delivering an intense burst of flavour; the fragrant mutton biryani and the equally aromatic vegetable biryani with the delectable pineapple raita; the delicious kababs and tandoor items – vegetarian and non vegetarian – perfectly grilled, lightly crusted on the outside, juicy on the inside.  Saving the best for last is Tasneem’s signature Butter Chicken prepared in a unique way. Instead of the usual chunky tikkas of chicken, you are served pulled chicken (marinated and cooked slowly till tender enough to be pulled into strips) in a rich, creamy gravy. The resultant dish is a luscious blend with the gravy going deep into every bit of chicken unlike the usual dish made with chunks of meat with the gravy only coating the tikka. The Butter Chicken made in Tasneem’s style is also easy to have with the pulled chicken lending itself to being wrapped and eaten in any roti of your choice unlike the tikka style as larger chunks do not hold well in rotis like the thicker tandoori and paratha. While on rotis, there is an assortment of Indian breads, the garlic butter naan being a personal favourite, as is the velvety phirni we ordered for dessert.  It is easy to see that Tasneem has not compromised in any way on the high standards she set for herself when starting out and catering to smaller groups of people with her wholesome and appetizing home catering. For instance, her mutton kababs still have no tallow added, something many commercial establishments resort to, to increase volume and quantity. The change: from catering from her home, her setting is now TKK – a warm and inviting place – where she and her husband make you feel at home, providing exceptional Indian food with the young and enthusiastic wait staff providing excellent service. Tasneem’s home catering set a benchmark in Kathmandu. Her restaurant sets it once again. Will be back for the Nihari and Kabsa. Good luck and best wishes.

column7: Great flavor, service, and atmosphere are all consistent
column8: I went back five or six times during my three-week stay in Patan because the food is so good. Veg kebab, paneer makhani, and the beverage aam phudina panna are all repeats, but I've tasted pretty much the whole vegetarian menu and had good flavor with everything. My friend loved the butter chicken.  One time I overheard the table next to me make a special dietary request which I saw was honored: the proprietors are attentive, friendly, and give good service. Wait staff are better trained than most in Nepal. Outdoor seating among the courtyard trees is very pleasant, and mosquito coils are brought out without having to ask.

Tasneems Kings Kitchen is a rare find in Kathmandu. I've been coming back to Tasneems for almost two years now and I've never had a bad meal here, ever. Tasneem, the ever present host, is always there greeting at the door, stepping through the dishes to suit your mood and always ready to give recommendations.  Indian food in Kathmandu has oddly never been a strength for this city despite its proximity. Tasneem's Kings Kitchen is one of those locations where the food is an absolute labour of love, hard to find spices are imported by Tasneem and she puts them to excellent use.  Last night I was invited to a traditional Bora meal (8 people required), I didn't know much going into it. What awaited was multiple courses ranging from custard to carrot pudding to amazing mutton slow cooked over 14 hours. It was an absolute delight, our entire group savored each and every mouthful. (Let her know in advance that you want the Thaal Bohra feast)  There has been some recent additions to the restaurant providing covering over their bar and reception area, beautiful lighting and a wonderful courtyard. My special recommendations, go for biryani, butter chicken, naan and some chicken Multani Wings. Actually, try everything on the menu at least once, beautiful tasty food awaits. Tasneem puts everything into every dish, so, if you're looking for authentic family style dishes then look no further.

Tasneem puts her entire heart and soul into providing you the most authentic Muslim dishes served in true family style. We had a lovely meal with some dear friends which made us all feel like we were feasting together as a family. We've also ordered Tasneem's biryani for catering special occasions at home and it's always a hit!
The ambience is really amazing, reminds you of your Indian roots 😊 a great place to have a good time with friends or family both 😊😊

column7: The night i rediscovered Indian food in Kathmandu
column8: A perfect blend of taste and ambiance. From unique menu in drinks, appetizers and the main course it just won me over a meal.. Planning to visit soon

column7: Delightful wholesome food for the body and soul in a calming ambiace
column8: If you are somebody who likes good home-style food served with pure flavours then this is the restaurant that you would like to visit. Lets start with the ambiance, we were a large group of friends of 18 and were seated in the portico surrounded by plants that contributed to a natural water conservation system that self sustains the restaurants water requirements. Well appointed solar panels that do not jar the sights also contribute towards the power requirements of the restaurant. All of this is discretely set in a very natural environment. A place where you would like to relax and enjoy your food.  Then to the food itself. Had 6 starters cannot decide which one should get a special mention. All had it's unique flavours and authenticity, a welcome change from restaurants that have a common base for all foods. Most of the starters had the "Bohra" touch. For those not in the know the "Bohra's" are a small community in India that is know for it's unique dishes that tickle every palate and want in you. The serving that night certainly stirred my want to come back to the restaurant again and I was still on my starters. The of course was the main course, difficult to beat the starters was my initial thought and kept my expectations not that high. The lamb stole my heart, the best I have had in the valley in terms of texture and taste served with freshly made Indian breads. Lets just say if you like Indian food and are in the Kathmandu Valley this hygienic, environmentally friendly restaurant is a MUST VISIT. Oh did I mention that this restaurant is run by a wonderful couple who are dedicated in ensuring that your visit is an experience and not just a meal.  PS The cocktails were gratifying, complementing the food

I had a big Indian feast when I visited Tasneem's Kitchen recently with my friends.They definitely have delicious food but is also accompanied by a warm homely atmosphere.The staff are friendly and will to make your visit an experience.I would definitely recommend the chicken patties for the starter's with a chilled local beer.Then followed by the bori biryani and angara chicken which they are famous for... A big thank you to the owners Harsha and Tasneem for their gracious hospitality .... Will definitely visit you on my next trip to Nepal

I was in Kathmandu for a week and this cute little outdoor-indoor eatery was one of the highlights. Tasneem has been in the food business for the last 11 years and she opened up this restaurant about 2 years ago (or maybe a bit more). Her passion for food and people and making sure that everyone has a wonderful time are what make this place great. We ordered the butter chicken and the mutton kababs and the dal tadka. We washed it all down with gorkha beer and khukri rum and it was a meal to remember. Oh! And if she's feeling particularly nice about you, she'll probably bring out the home-made carrot pickle which was just wonderful. A must-visit place for sure.

I have been to this restaurant a few times and was never disappointed. Probably the best place for Indian food in Kathmandu. Even though they say Indian, the menu is different from traditional Indian menu. The items on their menu are very unique. The owners claim most of the recipes are from their family kitchens.  Loved their Chicken Multani Wings and Bohra Chicken Cutlets. Very unique that are not available outside. There are many other delicious items on the menu which require multiple visits.  Service is excellent. They make you feel at home.

column7: Absolutely the best Indian food i ever had
column8: Went here actually by mistake but i must say it was probably the best mistake we made. We were a group of three people and met Tasneem at the door as she greeted us in. Amazing hospitality, great decor, amazing service, but on top of all of that, the food was amazing. I travel for a living, and have been to over 17 countries this past year and i can say without a doubt, this was the best Indian food i have had. a must for everyone in the area. Even if youre not in the are, make a trip out there, you will not regret it. We went in very hungry and the people i was with including my self, are big eaters, we had Tasneem recommend things of the menu. And i kid you not, everything was amazing. From the Biryani to he tikka masala to the kebabs, to the goat (i am telling you we ate a lot) it all was all amazing. A must try!

column7: Great Food, Amazing Hosts, Nice Setting
column8: I was introduced to the restaurant and Tasneem herself by my friend who has been going to Nepal for over 10 years. I figured he must know some of the best places around. I was a little skeptical that the food would be as he said "the best Indian food you will have on this earth." But boy was he right.  Two times I've gone to Nepal now and both times I had stop at Tasneem's. The butter chicken is one of the best dishes I've ever had, anywhere, not just Nepal. The naan and other Tandoor-cooked dishes are also amazing. Tandoor is available for dinner only. Right this second, i find myself craving the dish. I dream about it and the next time I can eat there again.  Tasneem and her husband do a great job at service and marketing. The restaurant has a very homey feel to it. She herself said if she's going to spend all her time there, she wants it to feel like her home. The marketing is also spot on. Really cool and fun ads on facebook, live cooking demonstrations, and other events keep the place hopping. Not to mention the occasional drunken Chinese business party.  The delivery service is also convenient. Remember to grab a takeaway menu on your way out. I promise you'll want to go back very soon. Don't leave Nepal without trying this food!

column7: The delicious Halal food with Pakistani and Indian Taste along with touch of South Asia hospitality.
column8: TKK is one of the best spots to hang out with friends, I have tried most of the Halal and Indian restaurants in Kathmandu and other parts of the world, and could not find any taste similar to Pakistani food but the Bohra style food cuisine. The best part is its hospitality and service when each customer is treated is the guest of TKK. I will recommend everyone the Chicken Butter Masala and of Bryani TKK. Must try it.

I like non veg mughlai and prefer it when it's chicken speciality and love it the most when it's typical Delhi halal delicacies.  Tasneem's Kings kitchen in Pulchowk, Lalitpur is one such restaurant that serves authentic Delhi food on a plate in Nepal. What's more the food comes with same personal one on one hospitality that makes the experience even more enjoyable. You may taste the spices and the different flavours, but according to me they serve their heart on the plate.  The butter chicken is delectable and so tender and spiced so perfect it is like perfect balance of mother's love and traditional cooking skills. The biryanis are perfection in traditional dum pukht cooking.  I would definitely recommend a visit once, from then on you will make it on your own once a week at least, can bet you on that.

If you have to try Biryanis in Nepal, this is it. While others just slap coloured rice and par boiled meat and cook, Tasneem's serves authentic dum biryani cooked on slow flame over coal. The result; succulent meat with rice that captures every aroma you can imagine. Take it from me, did check out the kitchen to make sure of the cooking process and gracious Tasneem was kind enough to oblige and explain the intricacies of traditional Dum cooking style of Audh. Thumbs up for the biryanis. Will be back for more!

I usually don't do reviews, I am forced to do so as it made me sick after eating here. I think it was the mutton sheek kabab. Firstly, I didn't like the smell of the mutton kabab to begin with it smelt like a lamb meat and I believe it was old. 1 day after eating here I am feeling the gas and nauseated. Lastly, this restaurant needs to cut down on their oil/grease usage to prepare food. How can you make a dish with so much oil.

This place is a godsend for those of us in Kathmandu who sometimes finds ourselves looking for authentic Mughlai food. Unbelievably delicious Bohra Muslim cuisine food at very affordable prices. The host and waiters are very attentive and service is good n friendly. Food arrived quickly and everything was made really well. We started our meal with Mutton Sigdi and Chicken Tikka kebabs. They were flavorful and moist; marinated and spiced just right. My fav dishes are the Butter Chicken and the Chicken Sheekh Biryani. The ingredients were fresh and cooked in an authentic dum pukht style. This place is a true gem and perfect dining experience!

Order the butter chicken and that alone will make your visit worthwhile. It's the signature dish and it's delicious. As are the biryanis which are cooked in a traditional oven. The service is excellent and if it's your first time, Tasneem will visit your table to say hi. Definitely one of my favourite places to eat in the city.

We had the most delectable mughlai food at Tasneem’s Kings Kitchen. The mutton shaami kebabs and chicken mughlai tikka were juicy and tender, the biryani had succulent mutton with the right amount of spices, and of course the signature butter chicken is one of the best we've had. I especially enjoyed the Indian desserts gaajar halwa and pineapple halwa - one word, simply WOW! Guess the next time I visit them I'll just have the desserts for my lunch :) for as the name implies it was enough to make one feel like a King.  Overall I think this was the best Mughlai meal I have had in a long time and it took me down memory lane.  The staff was attentive and courteous and all kudos to the team for making this such a special occasion for my family!! Can't wait to go back on our next visit there.  Good luck & best wishes.

Now if you really know how a good biryani tastes like, I am very sure that Tasneems Kings Kitchen "Biryani" will make all your taste buds jump. "Chicken Seekh Kabab Biryani" followed by "Chicken Nawabi Tikka" is a top notch while the other dish in menu maintains pretty good standard for what the Restaurant-er (Mrs. Tasneem Sahani) has to offer. The management is all ears for any kind of feedback "just in case". In the end I'd quote Tasneem Kings Kitchen with " GOOD FOOD WORTH THE PRICE AND SERVICE". Keep it up.

column7: Best Meal we had in Nepal!
column8: We came to Nepal to go trekking and so only spent a couple of nights in Kathmandu. We love our food (and we are spoilt for choice in London) so we chose where we ate in Kathmandu very carefully to make sure that we made the most of our time here. We certainly were not disappointed when we visited Tasneem's Kings Kitchen.  Firstly we visited on 31 October 2016 which is Diwali, an important holiday in Nepal. In spite of that the service was first class and we never had to wait when ordering food or drinks. In fact our waiter was very attentive throughout the whole evening even though the restaurant was busy.  Secondly, our waiter was very helpful when it came to helping us with food and drink suggestions, pointing out what he thought we would like and special deals on the local beer.  Third, the food itself was delicious. Tasneem (the owner, who is clearly very hands on when it comes to her restaurant) went out of her way to recommend dishes that we might not otherwise have chosen, explaining the different flavours. The hospitality from her and her husband really made our evening and made a memorable meal into one that became the highlight of our time in Nepal. She is clearly a passionate foodie and even gave us some of her chocolates to sample which are also on sale (and delicious!).  All in all this was our favourite meal in Nepal. When we come back we will definitely visit and would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant with its fantastic food and friendly atmosphere to others.  Thank you Tasneem, we will be back!

column7: Simply the most authentic and amazing Biryanis and Kebabs in town
column8: I was at a complete vegetarian bootcamp for 2 weeks and some of those who were with me were more hardcore carnivores than yours truly. My Pakistani friend and Bangladeshi friends both craved some meat and biryanis. Took them to TKK and BOOM! Exceeded expectations, they absolutely loved it. They didn't expect to find anything like this in Nepal apparently. Thanks to you guys. Cravings dead.

It's an impromptu visit to this wonderfully managed restaurant.Its interior decoration fascinated me;simple but beautiful with some Bollywood vibes. Its top floor sitting area was very cozy & relaxing. Food was absolutely amazing; Biryani part was unforgotten!!! Other part was the attendant who was so courteous, helpful and attentive.TKK was always on my mind as one of my friend described about it so much. And here the visit was worthwhile!! Overall impression(food, ambience,hospitality & hygiene) was amazing except the rate of drinks.I found extremely expensive menus for drinks.If they could do something, it would be great. Highly recommended to everyone for its authentic & delicious Indian cuisine. Love to come again!!! P.S. Thank you Tasneem for your warming welcome gesture.

column7: Amazing hospitality and food! 我最喜欢的印度餐厅!
column8: The first time I visited Tasneem's King Kitchen with my cousin. She kept raving about their butter chicken. I arrived with a lot of expectations and the food didn't disappoint. To add to that, the owners are so lovely and they tend to all your requests. Tasneen is such a beautiful soul who is incredibly passionate about cooking and you definitely can see that on the menu. Her food is definitely as nice as she is. The ambience is really relaxing. I love sitting outside in their courtyard. If it was not for the fear of gaining too much weight I probably would eat there everyday!  我喜欢经常到这里来。这是在加德满都我最喜欢的餐厅之一。我经常点 Butter Chicken 和Chicken Sheekh birayani.

TKK is the place to go especially if you want to impress your family and friends with the Indian cuisine where prominent flavors of exotic spices blend together with the main ingredient in such harmony that the luscious taste of the final outcome lingers on to their memories for long.  I love the way chef Tasneem comes over to each table once the guests are seated, to make sure that their expectations are met, with care.  My own experience with TKK regarding their service for home parties has been very pleasant, every time I sought for it. This is mainly because chef Tasneem loves to consider every little details that are important for you so that you get to host your parties with least hassles while reaping up raving reviews for the food :-)

The building & premises of the restaurant is well maintained. Still gives traditional look . Enjoyed staying at courtyard. Also admire the ecofriendly settings. Food was tasty & nice presentation . The owner was very attentive ! To go with the concept or theme of restaurant it could make it more meaningful to have relevant music played rather than western ones !

Tasneem and her restaurant are simply amazing! Whether you are living in or just visiting Kathmandu, then Tasneem's is a must for at least one of your meals (though chances are you'll be very tempted to go again). I host a monthly dinner club in Kathmandu, and we went to Tasneem's for our most recent gathering. From the minute I created the event to when we were walking out of the door at the end of the evening, Tasneem and her staff were kind, accommodating, and professional. We had over 25 people come for the dinner club and Tasneem arranged two different spaces in her restaurant to accommodate our large group--one outside in the beautiful garden space, and another in the upstairs level of the restaurant in the case of rain. When I arrived at her restaurant, she promptly greeted me and gave me a tour of the space, and was present throughout the evening to make food recommendations and ensure that everyone was happy. And that doesn't even begin to describe the food, which is the best Indian food I have ever eaten. Tasneem has been in the food industry for over 10 years, and her experience shows. I only have a few weeks left in Kathmandu, but I am going to make returning to Tasneem's one of my priorities. It's affordable and simply delicious. I highly recommend the butter chicken and garlic naan.

The Kabsa experience at Tasneem's is to die for. Well done, well made and expertly presented. Recommend the Kabsa over everything else. Though I did hear the other food on the menu is equally good. The quality of the food was only overshadowed by the hospitality and service of Tasneem. The staff are very friendly and the proprietor herself is extremely hospitable and went out of her way to make the whole evening a memorable one. The food was customised to the likes of all in the party which made it even more special. Though the restaurant is not wheel chair accessible , the staff ensured all the right preparations to help one of us. Thank you guys.

The foodmis cooked on charcoal and fantastically tasty. Oh my the butter chcicken, we have it almost every time. Check out rhw chocolates they are divine. The venue has interesting character and a great vibe. But mostly tasneem and the staff are so friendly she makes every visit feel like you are a special guest

I cannot say enough good things about this place. This is by far my favorite restaurant in Lalitpur. I went for the first time with my husband and 2 kids last night. We had a couple appetizers, Kashmir Chicken and Palak Paneer, Jaree rice and chipati bread. They also gave us a sample of their signature dish, Butter Chicken. The food we ordered was fantastic, but the Butter Chicken was divine. If you go, try their signature dish, but based on our experience, you cant go wrong no matter what you order. I get the impression that our dishes were not as spicy as they normally make them as we had two small children with us and we asked them to keep it spiced for the kids. My husband had gone with a friend on a different occasion and he said that the food was much spicier (and delicious!).  But the food was only the half of it. The owner is so kind and engaging. Made us feel so welcome. Our waiter made recommendations on how much to order (perfect amount!), the food came out fast but without making us feel hurried. The best part was that we had brought our 16 month old and 3 year old with us, and the staff helped us entertain them so we could enjoy our meal. I don't expect that can happen every time (eg if its a particularly busy night), but it made the whole experience perfect.

column7: Best food and the best hospitality..
column8: Indian/halal food has never been any better!!! Love the food. I've been to this place a couple of times and everytime we over eat and get extremely stuffed. The food is the best in Nepal. You'll not get such great taste all over Nepal. The quality and the service is unmatched. Last but not the least.... the owners are a great couple. On every visit, they take personal feedback of the food. I've been to allmost all restaurants in Kathmandu, but this place doesn't feel like a restaurant. I feel like I'm at home. Thanks Tasneems kitchen and the lovely couple for making our every visit worthwhile!!!!

column7: Worst biryani and desert ever( price is not reasonable...)
column8: I went on march 8 making my mind to have chicken biryani. I have had chicken biryani for more than 20 times while my visit in india for 20 days so i believe i have great taste on biryani. So hearing a name tasneem and seem to be nice and review were quite well i went today and order chicken biryani and it was the most terrible that i had in my life..totally disgusting.. 550 for biryani.....And the worst part is yet to come..i ordered desert Gajar ko haluwa to make a good taste but it was even worse...the weird thing was it was so oily and gajar ko haluwa is supposed to made on ghee and milk..they had surely used some colour and taste ingredients which made my taste even worsE...So if you don't believe me then you can go and waste your moneyon these two things and you will find out.

column7: It lived up to high expectations!
column8: I couldn't resist the promise of good butter chicken and I was very pleased indeed. The staff was very polite and the food was quick and excellent. My only "complaint" is that I couldn't sample more of the food because it was so good but I was so full from what I ordered. The butter chicken even had a bit of spicy heat to it which was really nice. It was well worth the walk and the visit!

column7: Best Indian Restaurant in Lalitpur (that I know of)
column8: I came by myself after a quick scan of Trip Advisor reviews. As other reviewers have mentioned: the fried mutton app and butter chicken are fantastic, and the service is great. I met Tasneem, her husband, and their adorable pug; they all hang out in the foyer of the restaurant. I'll definitely be coming back to get to know the owners better and to make my way through the rest of their menu.

You enter through a old style house by the road and on either side of you are traditional day beds, you will need these later. Ask for Tasmeen herself, and let her know what you are in the mood for and she'll put a spread of food in front of you like you wouldn't believe. She knows her menu intimately, and she knows what will go together. I believe in giving her free will to put your table's dishes as she likes. Also trust her as unlike other owners she won't just say have the most expensive dishes. After one meal you'll be hooked. And heading for the day beds...

column7: Best indian food and very attentive service
column8: The restaurant is decorated in a minimalistic, modern and refined manner. Not much plush and plunder. Only the stuff itbrealy needs. no WiFi as concept: people should enjoy the food and communicate with each other. Nice little courtyard. The staff withoutbexemption was very attemptive, friendly, and flexible. That contributes well to the unique atmosphere. All the food was extremely tasty and all was prepared fresh. What we can especially recommend: chicken tikka, kadai ghosh, mutton birvani (as soft and tender as it can be), paneer tawa, navaratna korma and Kashmiri aloo.  We will certainly come again!

column7: Great food served with a smile.
column8: Many placesserve good food here in kathmandu, what's different at Tasneem's Kings Kitchen is that it comes with a smile and with warm personalised service.  From starters that include amazing chicken sheekth kabab, onwards to main course of chicken angara and topped with biryanis every morsel is pure joy.  I entered this place with lots of expectations after reading the reviews, left with a grin ear to ear. Shall be back soon Tasneem. For the pineapple halwa i missed cause uou were sold out.

Tried it once, been hooked on to it ever since. Now it is on our weekly eatinerary. I and my wife religiously now make it to Tasneem's Kings Kitchen once a week to especially to try their biryanis. The king of biryani is their Chicken Sheeekh Biryani. Boneless, succulent and spiced just right. Every grain a royal delight. All other biryanis i have eaten here now pale in comparison.

I first reviewed Tasneem's Kings Kitchen not long after they opened. Update: this is still one of my favorite restaurants anywhere! Nothing beats their warm hospitality--or the luscious biryanis.  The succulent chicken tandoori drumsticks remain one of my favorite appetizers--rich with spices, tender, nothing like the dry red bones you find elsewhere. A number of new apps have made it onto the menu, including sweetly spicy Kashmiri aloo (which I could eat every day) and delicate, savory batata wada. The chicken tikka momos are a smart invention, and I hope they inspire others in Kathmandu to step up their momo game.  New specials are always appearing on the menu, and I am a big fan of the mutton dishes (the kaddhai ghosht!) sopped up with garlic or butter naan. But don't make my classic blunder and fill up on gravies before the biryani arrives. The chicken seekh biryani really will be the highlight of your evening...

Our family visited Tasneem;s Kings Kitchen for dinner this evening and food is ok, Beside raita and pineapple yogurt. Staff are ok and They don't know the meaning of "signature Dish". But they are good and polite. This is my first visit and first impression...More

Be it a quick lunch on a workday or a lazy dinner with friends and family on weekends, look no further . The Food is Awesome esp the Biryani and the hosts Tasneem & Harsh make sure that the service is Excellent. Best restaurant for Indian Food in Kathmandu. And Yes their Gajar ka Halwa is out of this world !

We ventured into the restaurant, not know what to expect and came out feeling wonderfully satisfied...the hosts Tasneem and Harsh, made us feel like we were in our own home.The kids had a tough time deciding where to sit as there were so many seating...More

Tasneem is an amazing personalised experience with sumptous delicious Indian meal. The service is super quick with excellent starters. Make sure you have a Sweet Lassi to start with. Ambience, Service, Food, Hospitality - All 5 Star.....

column7: feast like a king at Tasneem's Kings Kitchen
column8: No visit to Kathmandu would be complete without a visit to Tasneems king kitchen who serves the most amazing and mouth watering biryanis and kebabs. thoroughly enjoyed the overall dinning experience with a ever smiling face of Tasneem the lady running the show along with her team. the kebabs melt away in your mouth as you bite into them which has amazing aroma and taste which would linger in your sense for a long time and would make me visit them again and again.  Thank you for serving the best biryanis and kebabs in town ...

Pure Indian cuisine just like home cooked. Mainly because the owner Tashneem herself is overlooking each and every dish that is being ordered. Most Indian restaurants in town are very common in style and taste. But at Tashneem's the food is uniquely satisfying. It stays in your memory for a long time till you need to go back again. Ambience is simple and clean. Its just about the food.

column7: A century old recipie relived.A legacy. And the taste of the royals. Muhglai Extravazanza
column8: Ooh god when will Nepal start having good Indian Restaurant. Guys any place for Biryanis??  These are juz a couple of questions we discuss thinkinhthinking about Mughlai food in Nepal.  Tasneems is now open for a mouthwatering experience. A place where your tastebuds starts dancing. dekho kaise Jeeb Laplapai Is a statement for Tasneems.  Wonderfully designed menu and magic of the Indian Chefs specially who bring the legacy of Bora Mughlai Food. A blend of taste and tradition.  Go for it and see .
Kairos Cafe is greater than just a coffee shop. Tasty food, welcoming employees, amazing purpose. You will feel like you're part of a community!
There food was delicious, a cool place to chill out at. I really enjoyed getting to know the staff there; anything you ask they will make it happen in their polite way. Really gonna miss them...

Loved the food. Good variety on the menu and good quality. Loved every meal and couldn’t get enough. The walnut salad will be tried to get replicated at home . The staff were amazing and make you feel very welcome and at home.

Fantastic cafe! Great place to relax and enjoy the company of friends. Make sure you order the pancakes - you’ll be glad you did. And the coffee is the best. Wish we had a Kairos Cafe back home in Kentucky. Best of all, they have a wonderful mission!

This was an amazing place to hang and get good food! It’s nice to have it right next to a great bed&breakfast called five14. Great coffee and pancakes, literally all the food is the best in Kathmandu! It was amazing to be able to make great relationship with all the workers and the blessed me quite a bit so thank!
The black coffee is the some of the very best I have had in Kathmandu and I enjoy watching them make siphon coffee too. The baristas are friendly and professional.

The decor of this place is divine, homely and modern all in one, it's hard to tell you're in the middle of busy khatmadu. Served by helpful, friendly staff, the English breakfast is amazing, alongside a latte makes it perfection. Great job!
Lovely Place Heartful Staff Yummie modern Food Best Internet Sunny Terrace Best Coffee Price/Quality = T.O.P.

Our group took a cooking class here and learn how to make momos. They. We’re delicious! However mine looked nothing like a memo as a need much more practice! The coffee was also great and the cafe had plenty of space for work or leisure.
Been frequently visiting Kar.ma for over 2 years. Best coffee in town, their different blend is surely worth a try to any coffee lovers. Besides coffee, great atmosphere.

Definitely set out for coffee afficianados. They know how to brew here in traditional ways. It's difficult to find as their signage is quite poor but it is located on 3rd floor across from Moksh.  The nice thing about the atmosphere is its location in a quiet dead end parking area. Expect a more student, casual atmosphere. Not a place a to sit down to do work but more to hang with friends. Some of the decor is quite funky, i do like it, albeit its maybe too 'busy' with all the posters and leaflets.  As it was our first time, we were totally confused what to do.
