There are good shops surrounding it where you will not be overcharged if you bargain hard and some good cafes where you can have a peaceful drink overlooking the square. If you want a guide you will have no end of choice. there is an entry fee of a few pounds which is used to keep the square clean and in good repair

column7: Maybe the Best of the 3 UNESCO Durbar Squares...
column8: Patan Durbar Square has all the best of the architecture and history without the crush of traffic and crowds who gravitate to the other two. Also Patan is free - i.e. no entry fees unlike the biggest one - Basantapur.  Also, you have guest houses like Hira Guest House that are located in and around the square.  Make sure you visit the Golden Temple as well - 12 Century Buddhist Temple.

From the red bricked tiled floor, wooden carved struts, or the octagonal white stone Shikhara style temple known as Krishna Mandir - there is plenty to see in this Durbar Square.  Just beware of local 'tour guides' who approach you offering guided tours. Just reject their services. I made the mistake of accepting the one named Anil - not only was he not very good at explaining things, he would not let me take photos while he was talking, and had no understanding of 'personal space'. He claimed the tour was 1.5 hours, but it was barely 30 minutes. They are unnecessary and you could learn more from reading the pamphlet you get when you purchase the entry ticket or reading a guide book/Wikipedia.

column7: Ancient city in the middle of the modern city
column8: This place has once been partially destroyed by an earthquake. However, it has now been brought back to its original position. There is an entrance fee and if you are from a SAARC country, the fee that is charged from you is very much lower than what is charged from Western tourists. There is a museum inside the square and many shopping complexes as well.  In Nepal there are so many religious festivals and one the day that my husband and I visited this place, there was a festival. They played religious music and the women were dressed in red. It will be great if you can visit on a day of a festival as the place is very colourful on such days.  The history of the place is displayed and you can take time to read it and I suggest that you do that because then you get the real feel of what the square was and what it means to the Nepali people. The Hindus believe in Gods and Goddesses in the modern context as well. A young girl who is referred to as 'kumari' that translates as 'princess' stays in the palace in Durbar Sqaure and it is believed that she is a reincarnation of 'Kali'. You will not get an opportunity to see this princess. However, there are so many little temples all over in the square and it is worth a visit.

Shopping for fabric, spices, statues, cooking ware, and jewelry can all be found in this area. There is more of a variety in Thamel shopping district, but this area is important to see because everybody has been here and the city is ancient with temples all over the place. You will just find yourself with your head down, walking quickly through the streets because the pace of the area is quick. Motorcycles are zipping in and out and cars are honking to get through and people are everywhere!

The experience of visiting Patan's Durbar square is diluted only if you've been to Bhaktapur or Kathmandu's similar Durbar squares, otherwise, it socks you in the stomach for sheer presence and authenticity. Although the square is relatively small, the buildings are intact and so rich in detail as to keep you busy - especially if you're a photographer - for hours.  Roughly speaking, on one side are the royal palace buildings, and on the other side are the various temples, including one in South Indian or 'shikara' style, built of stone and dedicated to the god Krishna. The other wooden temples are in Nepalese architecture, some with erotic carvings on the roof struts. There are also a couple of metal statues on poles in the square, and plenty of details on the buildings to keep the visitor absorbed.  Various architectural styles are presented, with fascinating stories of various features. Pay for a local guide - it's well worth it, as much of the richness of the site is not apparent otherwise.  This is the authentic Nepal before development and traffic made the Kathmandu valley the sorry mess that it now is.

One of the must-see place in Nepal. Great historical site. If you are on your own, you can engage a local guide who can show you around and explain everything about the place. The guides are licensed (you can check their permits) and they charged a small fee for about 2 hour tour. If you want to make great pictures, be prepared to spend at 3 or 4 hours. Make sure the fee is agreed by both parties before you start the tour.  There are many shops to buy some great gifts. Look around first and compare the prices before you buy.

column7: Smallest of the Three Durbar Square's
column8: There are in fact three Durbar Square's in Kathmandu and the surrounding areas. In Bhaktapur and the smallest is in Patan. If your driving from the centre of Kathmandu it's about 30-45 minutes by taxi depending on the traffic. The square itself is similar to the one in Kathmandu although this one has a fresh water spring where the locals go to drink and wash. The area surrounding the square is equally appealing as the square itself, with many places selling very intricate bronze work, some of which is great value for money and some are antique replica's selling for a small fortune. Well worth a trip if however you want to visit only one Durbar Square visit the one in Bhaktapur which in our opinion is the best

beautifully done. seems a bit much to charge entry to the square....particularly if you want to do shopping in some of delightful little laneways that run of it [so make sure if you get a ticket one day you get it validated for the entire length of your stay in patan]. There's an awesome sweet shop nearby on the left hand side as you face the sq from the main road...on a little laneway on the left. especially great if the mountains are out. walk across the main road (more towards the market) and there's a nice viewing platform above the shops to get some great views

This is my favorite place in the valley. I’ve been coming to Nepal for many years. After I found this place, I don’t even consider staying elsewhere. The facilities are up to the best standard I’ve encountered in this country and I absolutely love the family running this. They are always ready to provide assistance and information. Also I am 100% sure no one can make a better porridge. Location is also perfect!

Looking for guest house style of accommodation in Kathmandu the Hira guest house has the uniqueness that only this style of accommodation can provide. Spent three wonderful night there recently and was extremely impressed by the friendliness of the staff, and it’s central location in Patan. Enjoyed a fantastic Nepali dinner on the night I dined in cooked by the guest house manager, unfortunately I can’t remember her name but she was certainly a delightful host - don’t forget to try the local yogurt, best I have tried. I found Patan to be a really safe location to explore, yes the streets are narrow and there is a lot of motorcycles - but this is part of the overall Nepal experience.

The hospitality,charm,warmth and atmosphere of this guest house makes for a memorable stay. The owners and staff could not be more helpful. The location is perfect. The bed comfortable. A privilege to stay in such an historic building in Patan. Be aware that you are entering a property of great antiquity and as such it has idiosyncrasies. The beautiful staircases are steep and narrow. The restored rooms lack modern insulation. The plumbing is not as a five star hotel. However worth everything and good value for money.

I have visited Cafe Soma in both Jhamsikhel and Baluwatar, and can say that they both have a lovely relaxed and chilled vibe. It is always busy, which is of course a good sign! The food is delicious, although a bit more expensive that other places. Both breakfast and lunch/dinner items are tasty, and the service time isn't too long either (considering Nepal service is usually slow). There are plenty of vegetarian options. Cafe Soma, Jhamsikhel, also has several charging ports near tables, making it a good place if you need somewhere to work with your laptop. It is a safe environment. Overall, a lovely cafe and definitely one to visit to have a modern escape from the city, and I definitely recommend that you try the brownie with ice cream and caramel sauce - delicious!
Delicious coffee and Beautiful continental breakfast!! The Eggs benedict is "OUT OF THIS WORLD". I love the fact that they do proper English style breakfast.

There are many cute coffee shops in the Lalitpur area, but what I like about this place are all the books available on the shelves. It reminds me of a bookstore. They are for purchase only. Would be nice if they were included for pleasure...More

column7: Oh, the Breakfast never disappoints me!
column8: I love Soma for it's breakfast options. I have been here couple of times in the morning after a long night of partying. The café never disappoints when you want to start a day with full, happy stomach. It's expensive, yes, but the portion is never disappointing. I'd be a regular if the prices were any lower. But I do feel like the waiters are warmer towards tourists than they are towards the local customers. It would be so much better if they were as happy to see local customers.

column7: Just returned from visiting the cafe
column8: Wasn't sure what to expect as it doesn't look like too much from the outside, but once you get the food all doubts are erased. I had a bacon burger and the beef is real. It was busting with flavor. The homemade lemonade was good but not exceptional. The warm brownie with icecream was also tasty but again not exceptional. It seems the quality lies in the hot food and sometime I want to go again and see what else they have that really is good. It is definitely worth the time and the service was excellent and food was quickly served. I waited no more than three minutes on any one item.
worth a trip for something modern and comfy. Was okay food, not the best i had in nepal by far. Atomsphere was nice however.
atmosphere is good cozy would be the word. books on the shelf make that place look intense. coffee is good and the cookies too. price wise its wise. on the budget.
Not too sweet and super fresh. They also make great banana chocolate chip muffins. A definite treat. ☺

column7: Fabulous food, at least the dish I always order
column8: Back here after 6 months’ absence from Kathmandu, I have to go for the Eggs Benedict, which is beyond wonderful. Probably in fact I am a rotten reviewer since I can never make myself eat anything else, this dish being so wonderful. To be fair,...More

column7: I would no place else for a good breakfast
column8: Great place for informal meetings where lots of local expats normally go to have breakfast. The staff are friendly, food is great and reasonable while the environment puts you in the mood for books, nice collection of books from the floor to the ceiling, while being able to be online with free WIFI available.

Alright, alright I was lured here by the promise of a great cheeseburger, but that’s not what brought me back. As a matter of fact the burger wasn’t even in my top 10 meals over my 2 week stay in Patan – it had this flavor of like a packet of onion seasoning. I didn’t love it – decent bun though. What I’d come to this place for is the desserts, muffins, and drinks. The banana chocolate chunk muffins are pretty damn fantastic. The brownies had a gooey crystallized sugar that for once among the brownies I tasted in Nepal – tasted like a brownie, not some mild chocolate dry cake. But the almond cookies are really what blew me away. I’m Sicilian and my grandmother and mother make cookies like these at the holidays. You only need one; it will fulfill the craving. And upon reading another review I opted to try the thick milkshake though it was cold outside – it was thick and yummy. Now to just expand the milkshake options: cookies and cream, chocolate peanut butter, frozen monkey (coffee, chocolate and banana). And to really make this place stand out…board games…they should have board games and a few heaters! No one would ever leave!!! I’d have book club meetings, knitting club, byob girls night, etc here because they have the right formula.

column7: The only REAL thick, western style milkshakes in town!
column8: Well, the only ones I've found. I came here specifically in search of a real thick milkshake, tipped off by an expat who claimed they know how to make them properly here.  I'm ecstatic to report I was not disappointed. Thank you, Soma, for finally satisfying my half-year craving for a real milkshake. And an espresso flavored one at that! I feel like Cafe Soma should do outreach to other restaurants in Asia to teach them how to make a real milkshake instead of serving flavored lassi's.  I wasn't that impressed with my chicken burger, and the chips are potato-chip style rather than fresh hot french fries. I think this place would be great as a milkshake/coffee/dessert hangout.

column7: Great food, Great service, Clean and Consistent
column8: Go here for the food. It is very well done western style dishes. I really enjoy the burgers and fries (all for decent prices) and when I recovered from Kathmandu belly, this is the place I frequented as I trust the hygienic standards and the foods are mild such as there delicious homemade soups. The staff are quiet, polite and accommodating and the food is cooked within a reasonable time and comes out together with the other dishes which is rare so far in my experience in Nepal. I have nothing to offer in ways of improvement, so Cafe Soma please keep doing what you are doing. This is one of our favourite locals.

cafe soma is one of the best place to have coffee , where we can get free wifi and free different books to read, and get freshly blended coffee are very delicious , i have been there with my frend , who came from dubai, he was fully satisfy with there, with well trained staff , cleaness, of their entire area . hope they dont loose but they will make more nice ...cheersssssss i love to be there and thanks to Mr.Lagan
Good food and a great atmosphere make this one of the best places to hang out in Kathmandu. There's a good range of books too. Thanks Cafe Soma. I'll be back!

I visited Cafe Soma based on a recommendation from a friend who is a resident in Kathmandu and had high expectations of food and service; i wasn't disappointed. The managers (a Nepali guy called Bishal who has lived and studied in UK) and the staff are attentive and welcoming. They know their products and are keen to make you feel at home.  The cafe offers a range of hot and cold food including burgers and wraps, cakes and pastries and freshly ground local coffee. Everything i have had over my many visits has been fantastic. Food of this standard is hard to find in Kathmandu, even in tourist areas.  It is well worth the trip to Cafe Soma for the food, peace and quiet, free wi-fi or a chat with the staff and owners. On those days when you want a taste of home and have had as many momos as you can manage, Cafe Soma will hit the spot.  10/10 for food, ambience and service.

A great little cafe that always seems relaxed and welcoming, with some great cakes and bakes for those people missing their home sweet treats! Indulge in their chocolate cake. A bit pricey due to the location, but free wifi and relaxed atmosphere from the hustle and bustle of city life make up for it. Also a wonderful place to go if there's a bandh!

If you're a tourist, this is the same as any shopping mall / shopping centre you will find anywhere but it's clean, modern and has a variety of places that you can eat at. It's very westernised if this is your thing. Decent to grab a coffee and chill outside but it's in Patan and not Kathmandu so I wouldn't make a special trip here unless you were staying close by.

Not really much in this mall, but nice and clean, and a respite from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. Good eating places, cinema and some great clothes/shoe shops selling the real thing (unlike the knock-offs everywhere else in the city).

A brand new shopping mall in Lalitpur area - lies on the main road of Kupondole to Jawalakhel, just on the turn towards Patan Durbar Square and famous Krishna Temple. Very easily accessible by personal car, bike, taxi and even public transport. Attractive and modern building with great interiors and decors. It has many branded and other range of shops and famous for shopping. Truly attractive restaurants and bars with tempting foods and drinks, from Nepalese, Indian, continental and others. Three movie halls names QFX showing Hollywood, Bollywood and Nepalese movies. A must visit place to spend evening

column7: A fabulous way to decompress after visiting Patan Durbar Sq.
column8: First, I know this as Yala Mandala restaurant - and that is what the business card says but it is reviewed here as Yala Cafe. As I live in Kathmandu as an expat, I can say the food and service are consistently very good and it is good value for money. The dish I order most often is the Thali - they call it something different on the menu but ask the waiter or look for the description of various small dishes (cured vegetables, pickle, paneer cheese and rice) served on a platter - vegetarian or meat options available. It is delicious and presentation is super. If you are interested in trying something totally unique drink wise, ask them to demonstrate the pouring of the local Aeyla. The better quality ones Yala serves are actually very smooth to drink - the cheap stuff in other local bars tastes as if it could clean limescale off water pipes. The biggest problem is to find the place. There are no street names and local people don't know it or send you to a different place so here is my recommendation for a wonderful afternoon in Patan which culminates at Yala for dinner! First, visit Patan Durbar Square, a world heritage site of ancient temples and King's palaces. Do stroll around the nearby market - spices, metal items and flowers for temple offerings. After that, use GPS or your tour guide/ local person to get you to the Golden Temple. This is a fantastic temple to visit - one I take all visitors to - it doesn't disappoint. A guide is useful as there is so much crammed into the small courtyard and you could miss and/or misunderstand much of the symbolism. Afterwards, as you exit Golden Temple turn right, stay on this street - and it's a 2 minute walk to Yala. It will be on your left side and there is a freestanding temple structure almost outside it. The sign is easy to miss -- keep a keen eye for the word Yala! Spend your evening enjoying the great food, outdoor candelit dining available, and friendly service. The staff will point you in the direction of the best place to get a taxi. It's easy to get a taxi "from" here but not "to" here.

We had a fantastic late lunch in Yala’s beautiful courtyard. Staff were friendly, attentive & were able to make good recommendations from the menu. We had a variety of meat & vegetarian dishes from their Nepali specials menu. Food was wonderful & plentiful. Would highly recommend Yala

We visited on our last night in Kathmandu. What an amazing experience. 5 of us shared a selection of dishes. Every dish was delicious with fantastic flavours. The decor was simple and modern and the service from Prakash was outstanding. I am so glad we...More

column7: Ethnic Nepali cuisine done with style
column8: Raithaane has one of the more interesting menus you're likely to see in Kathmandu. Region/community specific dishes made with seasonal ingredients, alongside french crepes and good quality Nepalese coffee (house roasted) are all presented beautifully on unique ceramic plates and bowls. The courtyard is quiet, but not far from Patan Durbar Square, and the tables upstairs are a nice place to work your way through the very reasonably priced menu. Raithaane won't stay hidden for long.

Raithaane serves a fresh interpretation of ethnic Nepali recipes with local ingredients. Between two visits I have tried just about everything on the dinner menu. This might be the best new restaurant in Patan in years. You can always tell when you are among good company that is thoughtful about the food that they are serving. It is rare to be so pleasantly surprised while eating out in Kathmandu.  One would be remiss to overlook this gem, tucked right behind Patan Durbar Square. Wonderful space, wonderful staff, wonderful food. Highly recommend, a must-visit!

column7: A highlight of our 5 weeks in Nepal
column8: Modern interpretation of Nepali ethnic recipes and ingredients. Creative and unusual dishes which make a nice change from the usual Nepali menu. Flavorful and well presented dishes. Very attentive staff. Highly recommended.

This is one of the best hideouts of Patan. Besides the beautiful garden and great food and drinks, Cafe Cheeno is run by Rita Thapa, the founder of a community foundation, Tewa, that funds women community leaders to make a better living in the empoverished...More

Happened to come across this place when we were looking for a quick bite. The breakfast menu is not very large but everything we ordered was well prepared and fresh - crepe, pancakes and coffee.  The ambiance is very pleasing and outdoor seating area is light and comfortable, its a very homely style of restaurant. Service is quick and the staff are very friendly. There are plenty of pretty items on display to purchase such as bags, books, t-shirts and cups at reasonable prices  Overall, a great start to the day!

column7: A jewel : both the people and the food
column8: We have had a few lunches and we organized a group dinner in Cafe Cheeno, and were each time delighted with the great friendliness of the people and the quality of the food. You can eat typical Nepali food but we also had amazingly good clubsandwiches or a real italian cappuccino. Sashank, the owner, is an experienced host and was able to get a good team to make this place a jewel. Sitting in the garden the busstle outside behind the walls fades away because of the relaxing atmosphere of Café Cheeno

georgous hidden oasis with lovely garden or indoor seating with beautiful symbolic art on the ceilings. The facade looks like a bag/craft shop but once inside you discover a lovely cafe alongside fairtrade crafts for sale. Just outside Patan gate and worth seeking out, couple of doors down from Daikaima cafe which is also lovely spot.

column7: Peaceful and clean place with beautiful garden
column8: Located close to Patan Dhoka, Cafe Cheeno is one of the few good restaurant options when staying in the old town of Patan. They have a large garden and a few tables inside, in a warm and pleasant athmosphere. The inside of the restaurant is shop at the same time, where books aswell as good quality handicrafts are sold - most of them related to a women's project. The food is good - European style. In the evenings, there is usually only very few people around which makes it an peaceful option. During the day tourist groups come which makes the place less interesting.

The decor and outside seating is very pleasant. The food could be better. A bit too much salt in the soup, potatoes were green and greasy and a wrap with delicious ingredients but the wrapper was not fresh. A bit more attention to quality and...More

column7: Excellent breakfast and coffee in Patan
column8: We visited Of Silk & Salt every day during our visit to Patan. The staff are very friendly, the Turkish Menemen breakfast (baked eggs with roasted vegetables) was excellent, and they make really great espresso. Anne, the owner, was a lovely host and gave us some excellent tips for our travels through Nepal. We highly recommend their cafe, and hope to return on our next visit to the city!

column7: Amazing fusion cuisine in a cozy setting
column8: The French/Swiss owners make you feel as if you were at diner with friends and loved ones. Their years of working with the International Red Cross allowed them to travel all over the world and pick out the best culinary secrets of the countries that inspired them. The menu takes you on on journey on the famous silk road with a twist of inovation. Your taste buds will be solicited in a way that will make you want to discover more for sure....And they have a good European wine selection. You will love it! - Canadian globe trotter

column7: Superb, fusion flavours with a clever theme
column8: I love trying new food and wasn't disappointed to discover this restaurant. The difficult part was deciding what to try, so a few meals there resolved that issue! The Burmese Fermented Tea Leaf Salad was a new flavour experience for much enjoyed. I make and...More

I love the food here. Great flavours and well presented. Nice ambience.I particularly love the Thai betel leaf dishes along with a nice glass of Chilean red. Restaurant quality food with staff that make you feel at home.

Good ambience and quality food but, the quantity was quite less. The menu full of errors. The breakfast not served as promised in the menu (i.e. toast was missing, substituted with different not toasted bread)  I liked the wait staff's service, however, one of the other staff started sweeping as soon as we reached there (little after the opening hour).  Haven't tried the lunch so can't make a comment on that, For breakfast, I would not recommend it.

column7: Good and peaceful location, good service
column8: The hotel is beautiful and decorated with amazing Tibetan style bronze statues. Situated at the end of a small lane, no traffic noise with the exception of the airplanes taking off from the nearby Kathmandu airport. We visited in the beginning of September, when it was still low season - it was very quiet. I enjoyed the pool with the children of my Nepalese friend. We had super friendly service at breakfast by the bar tender Prakash Rokka.

column7: in the lap of cultural Heritage
column8: Patan is culturally historically rich and people can enjoy very ancient and antique manufactures . so patan is as it is capital of heritage and the hotel good will also trying to reflect the cultural and antique patan.

I liked the apartment from the first moment. It’s a lovely, cozy place , you will find everything to make yourself comfortable. Special thanks to Rabi who was always ready to fulfill my wishes and to the landlord couple, very friendly and helpful persons! Whenever I return to Patan, I will definitly stay at that place

column7: A Taste of Luxury Before and After your Trek / Expedition
column8: The Summit Hotel provides a luxurious experience whilst you are visiting Kathmandu / Nepal. You are greeted by attentive concierge staff and so the experience continues throughout your stay. The rooms have an old world charm whilst having modern amenities eg WiFi. The breakfast is buffet style with plenty of choice. There is an evening menu and on occasion, a tasty BBQ. There are a number of bars and restaurants in close proximity if you fancy a change. Taxis are easily and relatively cheaply procured to the airport / cultural attractions. NB The traffic in Kathmandu can be very heavy at times. Luggage and valuables can be stored by the hotel whilst out on trek.

We stayed for just two nights in Patan, with our first morning being greeted by the lovely hotel owner for a complimentary two hour walking tour! He showed us all the secret peaceful community spaces, shrines, temples and houses and also gave us a good detailed history of the town and Nepali culture. He was extremely hospitable and so friendly. The food was also so good! (We tried breakfast and lunch during our stay)- especially if you like a lighter meal. All staff were accomodating and hospitable and cleaned our room/ topped up water/toiletries/refreshments even without having to request. They also took card payments which was super helpful when travelling on a budget! Would definitely recommend this beautiful interiors and boutique style hotel.

Stay here!!! Sarita is the most wonderful hostess, and makes you feel so incredibly welcome. As soon as we arrived we were welcomed into the kitchen and sat with other guests helping to make momos. Very comfortable beds, clean rooms, and hot water in the shower.

We went to there to celebrate my sister’s wedding. We were quite busy as we are from beside side. I check everything to make sure everything is on place. I checked toilet which is very dirty and request cleaner to clean and put some more toilet roles which they didn’t do later when I used toilet. When food was served there is some food running out I asked the staff, where is meat?? Then staff replied if it is not there than finished, wow what a good answer and same answer I received later when I ask dessert. Trust me I am the organiser and receiving like that answer. When my sister and we are eating food we found some rice are not cooked very well I requested waiter to call banquet manager and he came and rush to check the rice but his replied is rice is cooked there is no

column7: Favorite salon in the world. I had my hair cut and style by sister Tanuja Ghale and love the result. She is such an amaz
column8: Favorite salon in the world. I had my hair cut and style by sister Tanuja Ghale and love the result. She is such an amazing person inside and out. Love the atmosphere! The space is bright and open.

column7: A beauty salon to feel at home
column8: Very personal and professional service! I had a haircut and will for sure come back for more. The ladies working at New Creation are friendly, experienced and make you feel at home.

I was pleasantly surprised about this hair salon! The way how they apply the color is in European style and also the advice they gave was great. They obviously listened to my wishes and act accordingly. Thank you very much and see you again soon!

I had a French manicure and a pedicure and both were excellent. I highly recommend a visit. They have a lovely outdoor garden which would make an excellent spot for a special event combined with a spa treatment.

I spend much of my year in Nepal and I always specifically wait to get my hair cut here! I've been four or five times now and I've never been disappointed - my requests are listened to and my blonde western hair is cut perfectly. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and the lady owner takes very good care of the other women working for her. Very reasonably priced and I've always managed to get an appointment quickly - though it's best to phone to make sure, as sometimes they are busy. I cannot fault this salon and I would highly recommend it!

This place is amazing. So happy to have found it. I needed my hair coloured desperately and they did a splendid job and went above and beyond. The price was very fair and a percentage gets donated to women in need. It’s a lovely relaxing and modern salon located in Jhamsikel. Tanuja and the girls there are very professional and I’m so happy I went. I will be back again most definitely for some of their other services.

column7: A special place, definitely worth the low cost
column8: I was here to have a pedicure, and got service way beyond my expectations. The staff is so nice and they do an amazing job. I felt so peaceful and rested durint my treatment, I almost fell asleep! Love this place and definitely coming back!

My five months stay here was safe comfortable and a good value for money business. The place is central to several services, and the view from the rooftop is great. The friendly staff, clean rooms and the great services make you feel at home. The gym and the covid safety protocols too are excellent

column7: The Best Serviced Apartment with excellent hospitality
column8: Their service and hospitality has been top notch. My family and I stayed here for almost a month. Every staff here went beyond their way to fulfill our requests and make our stay here comfortable. The breakfast was abundant and always on time. Clean rooms, great location, amazing staff members and the owner was so very humble and kind. We would highly recommend it to anyone coming to Kathmandu.

Absolutely the best for short or long term accommodation in Nepal. Location is great,in the center part of Patan. Lots of restaurants, bar and shops nearby and big mall at walk distance . Easy access to all. Staff are simply superb! Ready to help all the time and make you feel like home. Apartment is spacious, very high standards of cleaning. Internet super fast, big TV with international channels, nice and comfortable bedroom, Western style bathroom with hot shower 24h, kitchen with all utensils (rice cooker, microwave, stoves, blender, etc.). They also have a fully equipped Gym! Great value for money. Absolutely the best hotel/apartment we have ever been in Asia (we have traveled quite a lot!). Highly recommended.

column7: I would give more stars if I could!
column8: Let me start at the end. If you’ve never had an Ayurvedic oil bath, you have not fully lived! This exceptional treatment, which is their end-of-panchakarma ritual, is unlike anything I have ever experienced, and I am still walking on air, enjoying a lightness of body, mind and spirit that was my intention and desire when I initially booked the program.  I simply cannot say enough good things about Moksha. A few years ago I’d had a panchakarma elsewhere, but it was not a residential program and this time around I wanted a place to stay where I could fully immerse myself in the experience… and Moksha exceeded all expectations. The first and final word to describe my experience here is “nurturing”. Because Moksha is a small, intimate place (currently only 2 rooms for residential programs although they have plans to expand just slightly to 4 rooms, and many people just come in for day treatments) you are nurtured on every possible level… body, mind, emotion and spirit… and this is the true purpose of a panchakarma, to connect with, purify and heal every aspect of your being.  In retrospect, I really wish I had made more time to do a longer course of treatment, as 7 days really just begins to graze the surface. Regardless, Dr. Padma did a beautiful job of discerning through our consultation what my primary goals and concerns were and addressing them during my week.  The treatments themselves were incredible. They have a staff of practitioners whose caring hearts and hands make sure you are being maximally nurtured during each massage (so many different types!) scrub, cleansing process, chakra healing etc. Even the necessary but more unpleasant treatments were done with ultimate care and there was nothing that felt routine about any of it. Each moment felt as if it was being done and given to me for my specific needs and particular specifications. I felt deeply cared for.  And then there was Sanjay. Each morning I had two hours of personalized yoga and pranayama as well as some beautiful discussion time about philosophy (yoga and life) and as a yoga instructor back home, this was particularly impactful for me. He is an incredible teacher with a wealth of knowledge, but perhaps more importantly, his energy is as warm and pure as it gets. My time with him in conjunction with the cleansing and purifying treatments themselves was exactly what I needed at that moment in time, as I had just come to the center after a particularly impactful spiritual journey and needed the appropriate space and support to help me integrate the experience.  The food… what can I say. It is authentic Ayurvedic food cooked with love, specifically for your needs to nurture you from the inside out. Delicious.  The center itself (treatment rooms, residence, reception, dining area etc) is impeccably clean and the rest of the support staff was also exceptional, helping in any way possible to make my stay more pleasant. On the morning of my departure Sanjay made sure I had food before my early morning flight and some extra apples for me to take on my journey… so sweet. The whole experience was incredibly personal and touching and I can’t remember ever being so attentively cared for in this way.  Leaving the center and in the days following, I feel so incredibly good. The Ayurvedic system of treating and caring for the entire human system… mind, body and spirit… is highly effective if done right. If you are thinking about doing a panchakarma or getting any sort of Ayurvedic care, it is well worth your while to come to Kathmandu and spend your time and money at Moksha, and after being there, I wouldn’t dream of getting Ayurvedic therapy anywhere else. There is absolutely no question that I will be back, and I look forward to it. Thank you Moksha team… you are all a real blessing.

column7: Best place in Nepal for Ayurveda!
column8: I just completed a 10 day Panchakarma at Moksha Ayurveda & they completely exceeded my expectations. I came in to treat my chronic back pain and nasal congestion, and I came out 10 days later with both of these illnesses cured as well as feeling completely relaxed and ready to conquer the world. Each day, they checked in with me about my progress and did everything they could to make me feel happy and relaxed. They treat you like family at Moksha. Dr Padma is a very kind, knowledgeable doctor and she answered all of my questions with ease and non judgment. The yoga and pranayama exercises in the morning with Sanjay worked very well with my treatments. The massage therapists gave the absolute BEST massages I've ever had. The food was extremely delicious, healthy, and made specifically for my dosha. The treatments I received were all hygienically prepared, using only fresh herbs. Dr Padma did an excellent job explaining all the procedures, describing my dosha, and giving me advice for the future. I highly recommend Moksha Ayurveda for anyone considering Panchakarma. Even if you come in for just a massage, you will not be disappointed. They offer many different packages to suit your needs. I will definitely be back once more before I leave Nepal.

After visiting so many places more than a month and half for the treatment of my back pain. I got to know this amazing place where they make my back feel better. Wonderful service, highly recommended it’s truly “journey to blissful health “

How can a small center be a worldclass experience? When all the staff are higly trained and passionate about ayurveda. Over a long period of time, I have done 14 times of panchakarma in 5 different countries in Europe and the far East, and this center is just the best place to go if you are serious about your health. Dr. Padma creates a personal panchakarma-program to your individual needs, make quick changes if nessesary. The therapist are higly trained, supervised by Ram and make sure you are always very comfortable. High quality in massagetables, oils etc At the reception Nirajan welcomes everybody and helps in all matters. Sanjay teach yoga, pranyama, meditation and chakratreatment with such a special insight and healing power I have never tried before. It is a true gem. Do not miss the opportunity to visit this amazing place

Period: July 2017. Length: 10 days.  In short, Moksha are the best. The communication with Moksha via email while arranging your trip is quick, they send you an approximate program and price list per your request. They meet you at the Airport and bring you to the Center. You talk to Dr. Padma and she defines your body type and the treatment program. And the treatment starts. You live in a room right there in the villa. They make the meals on the spot. I was there in July, the “rainy” season with the cloudy sky and the daily temperature of 26 C. Not a bad time to come to Nepal. The Center is a villa with a garden, located in a quiet street of Lalitpur, a satellite city of Kathmandu. Taking into account the dirt, dust and terrible roads/streets of Kathmandu, this may be a plus. Lalitpur is cleaner than Kathmandu. The team are: Dr. Padma, Mr. Sanjay – yoga instructor and Ayurveda practitioner (he is such a cool guy), Nirajan – the manager and arranger of all things, Mr. Ram and two young men, Santosh and Milan – Ayurveda practitioners and masseurs. There are also several young ladies who do procedures to ladies. The cleanliness and hygienic norms at the Center are excellent. The procedure rooms, the procedures themselves, the oils, the towels, everything meets the highest hygienic standards. They take everything seriously: they are well equipped for the procedures and follow some strict rules. Ram, Santosh and Milan are excellent masseurs with strong hands who give the best oil massage. The massages they provide are very intense and tough but you can ask and regulate the intensity at any time. The massages are performed according to some principles which are beyond my competence: the hand movements along flows of energy in the body etc. The massage may last for two hours and even longer. They take it very seriously. In general, the whole team takes their work very seriously. If they do, they do it good. The procedures are lengthy, performed thoroughly, at a price much lower than probably anywhere in the world. The Center provides the comprehensive range of Ayurveda procedures (the list is available on their site). The basis is various oil massages plus daily yoga and pranayama classes. There are procedures such as synchronized 4-arm whole body oil massage and scrub with ginger and rice powder, or a massage with constantly flowing hot oil performed by six masseurs. Another procedure is Netra Tarpana: they pour oil on a patient’s open eyes. Although this may contradict the modern medicine, the improvement for my eyesight is obvious for me. Every morning you also take some minor procedures such as neti (nose cleansing). At the end of the treatment, they sell you some medicines to take home. Not much, not expensive. Minuses: First: the meals are a disaster. What is even worse is that the meals during the diet periods become scarce. You might have to request proper meals or go outside and eat properly on your own. Second: the rooms do not meet the criteria of comfort in the Western standards. One might consider living in some hotel nearby and coming to Moksha for procedures only.

if you are considering taking some time to treat your self ,you have come to the right place.  I’m very thankful to everybody at moksha team for their loving kindness, guidance and help.  everybody was always welcoming with warm smiles in their faces.  the therapist as well as the specialists are very knowledgeable and professional.  the treatment rooms and facilities are very clean and well kept.  food is delicious (MITO MITO) specialy the MoMos.  Moksha definetly exeeded my expectations and i would 100% recommend it to any one looking to improve their health.  thanks moksha for everything.  warm greetings  Nabi.

column7: A Home Away from Home - A Place to Reset
column8: This place is wonderful. They have a great variety of treatments, and the staff is extremely warm and welcoming. Sanjay always took time to check in with me before and after treatments to discuss my needs and progress.  The staff is skilled and knowledgeable, and provides dedicated service. I got a little bit of everything. The consultations were very thorough, and although I’m an Ayurvedic Practitioner in the U.S., I was able to learn a lot about myself from another point of view. My favorite therapies included the scrub, the facial, and the singing bowl treatment.  The staff was very accommodating, providing a few treatments specifically for me. I was congested, so they made me an herbal steam to inhale while I was getting massages. They also made me an herbal blend to use with a neti pot. It not only rid me of congestion, but also reduced the inflammation in my sinuses. I also was able to get a ghee treatment for the eyes. It was very refreshing and nourishing.  Since I was getting numerous treatments every day, I ate at the center. Both breakfast and lunch were absolutely delicious, and they gave me plenty of food. I highly recommend the gluten free pancakes for breakfast. Meals were served on the rooftop patio, where it was so quiet and peaceful.  After leaving the center and returning back home, I could still feel the subtle benefits of all the treatments. The doctor prescribed various herbal formulas for me to use while at home. For some symptoms, I noticed instant results. Others take more time, but I see them changing over time.

My partner and I attended a week-long panchakarma at Moksha in March and what we received was way beyond any of our expectations. It is very rare for one to find people so honestly dedicated to helping one's health holistically, so in love with life and with such warm hearts. The team is competent, friendly and genuinely caring. Both of us have never experienced better massages. My boyfriend is in owe of Ram's skills, for example, but this knowledge applies to all other therapists too. The therapies and food are pure healing for the spirit, body and mind with very strong positive effects. They are both individualized, after a thorough consultation, and are adjusted based on the experience of the guest. The place itself is a small island of peace, perfect for contemplation, relaxation and internal silence. We enjoyed absolutely everything and would love to go back there as soon as possible. Thank you, Moksha team, you are all very special people running a very special place :) Big hugs, Denitsa and Denis

column7: Highly professional and great value ayurveda
column8: Premises are set back from a quiet road, clean and beautiful. Treatments fantastic. I have had lots of massages, including ayurvedic. I even trained and worked as a masseur in my youth. Without a doubt, Ram delivers the best massage I have ever had..I had 5 in one week, they were so good! and hope to have more. I also had a couple of sessions with the Singing Bowls. Frankly I was a bit sceptical at first, but was amazed with how profound and transforming the experience is; also will have more next trip. Sanjay and Dr Padma are charming and genuinely caring and make you feel very welcome. I have been sticking to the ayurvedic prescription that Dr Padma gave me and notice positive changes in my condition.

my boyfriend and I did the cooking class in Kathmandu and it was so great! We learnt how to make masala tea, roti, egg rolls, dal, aloo chop and momos (you get lots of options about what you want to cook). The class was really fun and informative and it’s in a really clean kitchen with a nice atmosphere. You make heaps of food so it’s a really tasty feast once you’ve done all the cooking!! Seriously recommend this class.
Nepal is fantastic with all different cultures and Sushma, the owner, is both competent and sweet and a very good teacher and chef. Now we know how to make dal bhat when we come home.

column7: Highlight of our stay in Patan and Kathmandu
column8: We booked our 2Sisters Nepal Cooking School class at the last minute at the end of a month long stay in Nepal and it was the best decision we made. There are three times offered for the class, which is very flexible, and we opted for 9am. At the start of the class we were offered the menu choices, and opted for chatamari, daal bhat and chocolate momo.  The location is great - the corner of an interesting complex in a quiet part of Patan, with a courtyard just outside where you can enjoy each dish as you cook it. We were staying in Patan and enjoyed the walk there, but 2Sisters also offers free pickup from Thamel.  The food we cooked with Shusma's help was super delicious! I was surprised at how quick and easy the chatamari was to cook. After eating lots of daal bhat during our travels, it was great learn how to make it ourselves, and the daal was sooo tasty and lovely and thick - no watery half-cooked version here! I didn't think we had room for chocolate momos but the high quality chocolate and ratio of pastry to chocolate to butter was perfect, we had no problems at all scoffing them down. :)  Shusma is a lovely host, we felt comfortable in an instant with her, and she is very kind and supportive. You really don't need to know 'how' to cook as she will guide you through the whole process. The time passed so quickly, just chatting away, making funny shaped momos and exchanging thoughts about our lives and travels. It was great to get more insight into Nepal from a local.  Shusma's kitchen is very clean, and all the ingredients are organic and high quality. There is purified water for drinking and preparing the ingredients, lots of soap and water for your hands, hand sanitiser, and aprons and hats for everyone cooking.  Finally, I need to mention the delicious masala tea we made and enjoyed at the start of the class. It was so warming, great on a chilly November morning. I am dreaming about that tea back home!  This is a great activity for anyone who loves food, whether you are an experienced cook or a complete beginner. All you need is a positive attitude and an empty stomach! Thank you Shusma for such a memorable experience.

column7: Cook Nepali classics and get an insight into local culture
column8: We did the 9am class with Shusma and cooked 3 delicious and simple recipes - Chatamari (a crispy rice pancake with egg, paneer, spice and herb topping), Dal Baht (very tasty Dal, with fragrant Basmati rice, delicious vegie curry and fresh zingy chutney) and chocolate momos. Shusmas directions were easy to follow and the pace of the class allowed plenty of time to chat about the food, culture, politics... whatever you feel like. After each course we sat in the courtyard to enjoy our creations. There are a range of dishes you can choose to cook and a pickup from Thamel can be organised, although we enjoyed a nice walk from our accommodation near Patan Durbar Square (a good opportunity to check out a different neighbourhood, with some nice cafes around). Highly recommended!

I would highly recommend 2 Sisters Nepal Cooking School! My partner and I booked in for the morning session and it ended up only being us two in the group. Shusma had a driver pick us up from Thamel and it was a fairly quick drive to the school. The kitchen was lovely to be in, felt safe and very clean. We made momos and they turned out amazing! Shusma was such a pleasure. She told us beautiful stories about the food, where it comes from and the Nepalese culture. Make sure you go on an empty stomach so that you have room for all the amazing offerings!

We absolutely loved this cooking class. Great instruction, delicious food, and a recipe book emailed to you after the class so you can make the food at home. The guide made it really fun and was very knowledgeable. The group we cooked with was fun too. Participative, everyone cooks their own food, which we preferred over a demonstration only. Can’t wait to make momos for everyone when we get back!

After eating a lot of Daal Bhat during my trekking it was a grat experience to cook it myself. Also learning to make Mo:Mo's myself was fun! Shusma did a great job in teaching us and it was lots of fun with her!

We had an amazing time at 2Sisters, being taught by the wonderful Bina. We were picked up from Thamel and given a choice of menus to cook - starter, main and dessert. Bina gave us background on each of the dishes and we got fully involved in the cooking and preparation of meals. We ate all our meals in the sunshine in the garden just outside. Highly recommend - an excellent way to eat Nepali and learn more about the culture. Thank you! And make sure you arrive hungry!

Us girls had a fabulous time at the 2 Sisters Nepal Cooking School yesterday with Shusma learning how to make traditional local cuisine and also learning about Nepali culture. The money raised from the classes goes directly to their NGO which supports young children’s education in rural Nepal. We feasted and had a wonderful morning full of laughs and came home with full bellies ☺️

My Mom and I had an absolute blast meeting Shusma and her assistant & attending this class! The food we made was better than restaurant quality and now that I’m back in the US have been trying these recipes at home which my family is loving! The facility was spotlessly clean, we chose to make a vegetarian meal and it was so tasty and fun. We also got to ask lots of questions about Nepal and we didn’t have to worry about transportation either!

I attended an evening class with two of my friends and it was a wonderful evening! The food was delicious and easy to make. Our instructors gave very easy to follow directions and made the class lots of fun! We made Chatamari, dal bhat and chocolate Momo's. I can't wait to get home and make Momo's! I would highly recommend 2sisters for a very well run class and introduction to Nepalese cooking!

column7: Excellent experience in cooking Nepali food
column8: The owner of the school is super nice and sweet. We first made a booking, however, we could not make it because of traffic jam. Owner soon rescheduled the class for us. Also, transportation is provided from Thamel which saves us from wasting time finding the school. The food is very nice and exotic. Cooking steps are clear and easy to follow. I highly recommend you to go if you are interested in cooking!

column7: Must do in Kathmandu - special time in our trip
column8: Definitely one of the highlight of my stay in Nepal. I learned a lot about local ingredients and ways of cooking but also about the culture. It was a real pleasure to exchange about everything and to see all Shusma's ideas to create positive impact. She really empowers women and she's definitely someone you want to learn from.Time flied that day. The plus is also the ebook sent at the end, I just reproduced a recipe at home and everyone loved it. A must-do in Kathmandu/Patan. Thanks again!

column7: informative, fun, and delicious cooking class!
column8: I had a great time learning to make traditional Nepali dishes; it was a lovely way to spend my last afternoon in Kathmandu. This cooking school helps to employ and empower Nepali women and fund child education; the heart behind the organization really shines through in the one-on-one interactions with staff members. Shusma was able to accomodate my vegan & gluten-free diet and all the food she taught me to make was delicious, with easy-to-follow recipes. Come with an empty stomach!

I attended a cooking session with a number of fellow students and could not have had more fun! The food was delicious and the guidance was perfect, but to me the best part was meeting the instructor. A fascinating woman, she was incredibly warm and informative, teaching us much about Nepali culture that we would otherwise not have known. Her hospitality and the stories she shared made us feel like we were standing in her personal kitchen. Definitely worth every penny, especially with some of the proceeds going to help empower marginalized women in other regions of Nepal.

column7: A fantastic evening cooking delicious food!
column8: Shusma worked really hard to make sure all of the group had a fantastic experience! We had a choice of different dishes to make for each course, all of which looked delicious! They can easily cater for different food requirements e.g. veggie or vegan. All the things we made we got to eat and they were delicious! The recipes are easy to follow can easily be recreated at home, especially as Shusma sends the recipe book to you via email. Would highly recommend as a half day fun activity for tourists or expats living in the Kathmandu!

column7: Make time for this amazing experience
column8: What a wonderful way to spend an afternoon in Kathmandu! After finishing our trek to EBC we had a week in Kathmandu. Cooking a traditional Newari meal away from the chaos of Thamel was a welcome break. The owner, I’m sorry I forgot her name, was a pleasure. She took time to explain the ingredients and their importance within the the culture and was great to talk to. The meal was outstanding despite my poor attempt at folding momos. Speaking of which make sure to make the chocolate-coconut ones! They’re amazing!!

column7: Delicious Nepali food that I can now cook!
column8: I would recommend to anyone who wants to do something unique in Kathmandu and really experience the Nepali culture! Shusma is a great teacher and goes through every step to make the perfect Nepali dishes. We even went to the local grocery shop to buy the ingredients before, where Shusma showed and explained to me the different vegetables and what they're used for. This gave me a real insight into Nepalese cooking. You are also given so much flexibility to choose the dishes you want to make (starter, main and desert). Finally a percentage of money she makes at the cookery classes goes into Women's empowerment- so definitely talk to Shusma about this as she gave me so much insight into the caste system, gender equality and what it means to be a women in Nepal.

I just had a great cooking class. The dishes wre delicious, the staff is patient and very relaxed. It is with a great personal touch and you support school childeren in Nepal with the profit they make. What's not to love?

We had so much fun with this cooking class. Susila was such a friendly and funny teacher, the best momo maker ever. We were picked up from the hotel as we were the only ones. The school is situated in a nice and quiet area just outside Kathmandu with a beautiful garden to eat in. We could choose what we wanted to make and we chose the Nepali pizza, Dal baht and momo’s. The dal baht we made was the best we ever ate in the two times we visited Nepal so far. We would definitely recommend this course!

My friend and I chose to do a cooking class at 2Sisters to kick-off our Nepal trip and we are so glad we did! The food was amazing and Shusma, our host/instructor, was very professional in teaching us how to make authentic Nepalese food and really made us feel welcome and relaxed with her fun personality and great stories. As per other reviews, it really is like you're cooking with a friend! Definitely worth trying!
What a pleasant welcome! A cool family environment in a traditional exotic style . I would like to recommend the most to visit here once you are in Kathmandu. #visitkathmandu

After trekking for six days and eating Dal Bhat, I wanted to learn how to make it. Sushila was the best teacher and we laughed making many dishes.  If you want to meet local Nepali and learn how to cook delicious food then go here. Also, supports a great cause. Enjoy!!!

Where to begin with this incredible experience! We met Suchila, our leader for the night, at 5 pm and were immediately made to feel comfortable. Her exuberance about cooking and Nepali food carried us through the night! After deciding which menu to make, we went to the local market to pick out vegetables. Back in the kitchen, we were shown how to make a full Nepali meal including milk tea, an appetizer, entree, and dessert. Suchila is a patient and fun teacher and had us laughing our way through cutting vegetables, sautéing onions, and finally folding momos. This is an opportunity not to be missed and one that my friend and I enjoyed so much, that we are going back for another session!

My friend who came to the cooking school last year recommended me to do the cooking class with 2sisters when I come to Kathmandu. So I did! I landed in Nepal for the first time around midday day and booked for the 5pm class on the same day! I learnt how to make Thukpa, veg mo mo and carrot pudding from scratch and I was shown the Nepali way of cooking. Sushila and Shusma are super lovely people! I enjoyed the experience and what a special way to Valentine’s Day and my first day in Nepal!

I had an amazing time at the cooking school! That day I was the only participant and so it was actually just me and one of the sisters, but we honestly had such a good time! Although it felt like cooking with a friend, the session was really informative and I learned a lot of different tips on how to make nepalese food. It started with choosing a menu made of three dishes, after that we went to a local market buying the products that we needed and then the fun began. First I got to learn how to make the traditional Masala Tea and after our cup of tea, the preparation of the dishes started. We had a lot of fun making Chatamari, Aloo Chop and chocolate Mo:Mo, talking, joking around and laughing. After each dish you can eat the foods outside in the beautiful garden and just be amazed by how good it tastes! Finally, they send you all the recipes of the day and more, so that you can cook them again at home. The place is really clean and I love that they put a lot of emphasize on not trying to waste any food. I left the class with a full belly, good memories and a new friend! I can 100% recommend the place!

I attended the 2 sisters Nepal cooking class with my family and a friend and we all enjoyed the 3.5 hour experience immensely. A choice of three menus are offered, and after choosing, we headed to a nearby store to buy the ingredients. The menu consisted of three courses and after cooking each we sat down and ate our creations. The school in run by a lovely young Nepali woman who speaks perfect English after a decade living in Europe. Her two bubbly assistants make the class fun with their infectious laughter. I absolutely recommend the class to anyone interested in Nepali food and culture.

column7: Brilliant fun! Bringing gluten free momos into the world!
column8: It was only myself for the afternoon but it was still amazing fun. The 3 girls who run 2 sisters are full of energy, always laughing and joking, whilst simultaneously supporting you to make some delicious Nepali food. I would highly recommend this programme to everyone!

Amazing and unique experience not to be missed. During our travels, the food we had was so delicious, the opportunity to learn how to cook it was not to be passed up.  Staff were helpful, friendly, patient and did the preparation so we could just concentrate on cooking and enjoying the meals (we cooked) in the pleasant  The idea of using the cooking school to facilitate empowering women is definitely worthwhile.  I would highly recommend the class and it was great to see both women and men of all ages participate and enjoy the afternoon.  Can’t wait to try out the new recipes when we get home.

If you are going to do a cooking class in Kathmandu (which you should cause it is a great way to bring some of the culture of Nepal back with you), I highly recommend doing it with 2Sisters. They were easy to communicate with before our class, picked us up in Thamel, and we had the best time cooking with our teacher sulokala. We really liked that basically got to pick and choose what dishes we wanted to cook. The school is back in a peaceful courtyard, a nice reprieve from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. After you complete cooking every course, you get to go out and enjoy your food in a beautiful setting! Sulokala was the extremely sweet, funny and knowledgeable, not to mention an amazing teacher. We also loved hearing about the background of the school and it’s purpose to empower local women in business, as well as the charity work they are involved in, building and supporting a school in rural Nepal. We cannot wait to use all of the recipes she taught us, plus extras she sent us over email! We highly recommend taking this cooking class, and make sure you come hungry because it is a lot of very tasty food!

We learned to cook 3 Nepali dishes, which was already a great experience! On top of that we enjoyed lots of interesting and inspiring talks with the cook and the founder of this cooking school and learned a lot about life in Nepal. I loved every minute in this place with its beautiful garden. If you would like to participate in a cooking class - book this one! Not the least because with your participation you support projects that try to empower marginalized women in this country!

Today I had a wonderful (private! :)) cooking class organised by the 2 sisters company! The pick-up in Thamel was handy and the women were really nice,friendly,funny and speak english very well. They even helped me with buying a good pashmina scarf for a Nepali price 🙂. I love the fact that the money is invested in charity projects and the owner is very inspiring. It was really nice to learn how to cook a fresh 3-course Nepali meal. The food and massala tea were mitho chha (delicious), make sure you arrive hungry!

So, I was one of lucky guys who was visited cooking school 2sisters. I was a chef in my country, so I am judging this course like a professional. Room is very clean, sanitariness friendly. Good and clean modern equipment. Each participant have access to his own cooking equipment.  In the beginning we have great experience buying ingredients for dishes. We going together to local market and buy all that we need. Also got an information about new fruits and vegetables that we doesn't have in Europe.  We cooked 3 dishes + masala tea. After each dish we eating and resting. So, you can spend great time in great company all day and it's wonderful!!!  Courses totally vegan and vegetarian friendly. So, you can choose between dishes with meat, eggs and pur veg.  Team is friendly, funny and very active. You will never be border with two sisters.  They teach every detail, so they know their work very well. Dishes was delicious. I so proud of sisters. I wish them good luck and success.  BRAVO!!!! AND THNX FOR GREAT TIME.

I always try to take a cooking class when I visit a new country, and I really enjoyed this one. I contacted the school via Facebook and was picked up for free near the garden of dreams/himilayan java. After a quick taxi ride, I arrived at the hotel they host the class at. I was allowed to mix and match the appetizer/desert from the menu so I ended up cooking chatamari, veg momo, and carrot pudding. Making nicely shaped momos is very hard if you’re not used to making dumplings or tortellini, but the sisters kept it entertaining. They have a good sense of humor and make the class feel relaxed.

This is something everyone should do when they're here. The two sisters are so passionate re what they do with personalised shopping trip to get the vegetables, traditional secrets and of course learning to make the momos! You get a choice of 3 menus, the carrot pudding Amazing!!! This school is the one to support as it the finance helps to empower women in employment. Loved every part of this experience!

column7: Beautiful Experience in a Beautiful area with some Beautiful people
column8: I found this cooking school on a flyer in my hotel and thought it would be a great thing to do before i left Nepal. I had been in Kathmandu for a few days and had tried Momos and eaten Dahl Bhat, so it was great to learn how to make these delicious food items along with three other delicious meal at this cooking school. The cooking teachers we fun, knowledgeable and patient with us as we made poor replicas of the food they were teaching us to make. This has to be one of the funnest things I have done in ages, singing, dancing, cooking and eating in a beautiful courtyard. 2 Sisters Nepal Cooking School is a great addition to anyone trip to Nepal ...... ........ and the food was just so yummy :-) :-) :-) :-) :-) Thanks guys for a wonderful experience

We just had a very lovely afternoon cooking with 2sisters cooking school. The girls are so much fun, we laughed, danced and singed in the kitchen, making delicious Nepali food that we can easily make at home. All the recipies are send by e-mail. And the girls took us shopping for the best spices in town. Definetly recommending this place! They offer a free pick up from Thamel. All the best to you girls, greetz Jop and Sharon
The Restaurant is nice, clean and modern..the staff very friendly and the Food was ok.. a bit dry but otherwise good.

A-la-carte! One of the best places around Patan. The restaurant is located in a calm atmosphere with really soothing decors, artistic set-up and the positive vibe you get as soon as you enter. Order your taste bud- Italian, Nepali or Continental, you would savor and would visit again. Bon appetit! The warm service is quite unique (I would be a spoilsport if I tell everything). Bonne Chance! You can really make things happen if you believe it and you would never miss to visit such an Utopian world. Bon voyage!

This place is great for service and good western style food, as well as cocktails. The place usually have happy hour which makes the cocktails taste even better (as it is 2 for 1). Strongly recommend this place!

column7: Great stay at a traditional Nepali house
column8: What I liked best about the Peacock Guest House in Patan, the bed. It was the best bed I slept in during my entire stay in Nepal. Very comfortable! Peacock is a stylish Nepali house. Decorated in traditional style which I loved. Ceilings are low, so mind your head. It was a bit chilly, but the bed was warm and the shower is hot. Located just a few minutes from the Golden Temple and a few minutes more from Durbar Square. Staff is friendly and will help out. Breakfast was good and there was plenty to eat. I booked my airport drop off thru the hotel and it was organised as it should. Taxi was 500 rupees. I enjoyed my stay very much at the Peacock chain (also Bhaktapur) and I would recommend this place.
One of the most happening places in Jhamel. The muktiple cuisine and the attentive staff members make it tue best place to visit. Undoubtedly, the food is excellent. We enjoyed a lot.

Me and my husband love this place. The Indian and newari food here is very delicious, mildly spiced and cooked just right. We come here almost every week. The place is also not heavy on your pocket. The staff here are very attentive, i think they are the star attraction of this place. They would greet you and make you feel comfortable right away. The restaurant has mithila arts all over its wall. The art is a unique form of paining from southern part of Nepal, and always made by women.

The Rock Beans Coffee it's a good exemple of  the best place we can find in Kathmandu. Peaceful outdoor area with modern modern art. Professional and friendly staff. Plus, coffee and tea are associated with tradition and modernity in a beautiful way. There is also...More

The place is perfect....great garden style outdoor sitting with beer garden and great food. The barbeque is amazing as well as their bacon wrapped chicken. The place is perfect to hang out with friends, or just hang out alone with a good book. The place...More

Nice place to grab a cup of tea or coffee. Great spot for culture, concerts, art, markets. Friendly staff. They have live music and films/documentaries on some nights. Good western style food and draft beer.More
Great peaceful outdoor garden place with drinks and momos. Drinks and momos were good too. Just make sure to take mosquito repellent!

Nice quiet cafe/restaurant in a garden courtyard set 50 yards down an alley away from the busy road. Friendly staff. They have live music and films/documentaries on some nights. Good western style food and draft beer (although it had run out when we were there). Also had a studio with people practicing ballet.
We drink coffee here 3 times and it was three times very good. The owner is a young starter and works with his heart. I guess he will make it. Good luck.
Dropped in for a coffee, first floor just past patan gate. Modern clean and the best coffee we have had in Kathmandu/Patan area. Staff great and can recommend...

The restaurant serves you a good Indian food along with the modern gestures of different alcohols. Its good place for a family including old and children. We liked the nan and chicken at this restaurant.
The staff are excellent. The biryani was very good, they could provide more raita and pickle with it, but overall very good. Nice and clean place in a new and modern mall. Recommended.

column7: Great place for dine at le mirch
column8: Yesterday i went with my friends at le mirch. very welcoming staff with great pleasure. service was very excellent and food was very delicious, there is choice of smoking zone in out side area with a nice city view which I feel like abroad. the...More

Well we were out for a movie on a Sunday at Labim mall. Saw a new Indian cuisine restaurant, the name was catchy and boasted about having only 2 restaurants one in Washington DC and the other in Kathmandu. So this place seemed nice from the outside hence we went in. Well i am still regretting why did we go in there ? Well when you go to a fine dinning restaurant especially Indian Cuisine there are a few expectations. They did not meet any of them. Starting with their veg menu did not have any spicy paneer item. That is still bearable. We ordered our food. In the mean while we were expecting papads which are usually given prior to your meal. We got them but we had to ask for the same. Then any indian restaurant does give you a main course plate with a side plate as well. The shocking thing was that their main plate was the size of the side plate and no side plate was provided. We ordered rotis as 3 plus 3 so that we get hot rotis but the service was so poor that we were left lingering for about 15 mins after the first round of rotis were finished. The food was average nothing great. Then when we asked for the cheque in any indian restaurant you do get a finger bowl or there are tissues on the table. No finger bowl was provided neither was any kind of mouth freshener .  The overall experience of dinning was extremely disappointing and would not go again or recommend any one unless they make drastic changes.

column7: I feel like a few of the bad reviews have nothing to do with the food...
column8: So, I’ll post one that is relevant. I came here highly recommend by a local friend while visiting Patan from the States, and I have to say I was not disappointed at all! The place was very nice, and was busy with what seemed like...More

column7: Authentic and tasty, fast food style
column8: A very Western-style burger/wrap/burrito joint with good food. Really yummy, authentic "fast food" style (but homemade!) hamburger/cheeseburger with a tasty sauce and on a soft bun, even though the meat is buff, not beef. The fresh homemade donuts are also delicious.  Highly recommended if you're looking for an authentic American-style food fast type meal. But better than fast-food in my opinion.  Wish it was open later though, 6:30 close means I can't stop here for an evening snack :)

column7: Excellent Service, Hygienic Food & Scrumptious Mexican and American Food in Lalitpur, Nepal
column8: I have visited The Workshop Eatery quite a few times and every time I visit, I like their limited but specialized cuisines appalling to the palate and the belly, minimalist but elegant and simplistic ambiance, quick and friendly staffs and service delivery. Most of all, it reminds me of the movie "Kungu Panda," as one can feel that they never forget to add the secret and special ingredient of love thoroughly in everything they offer and they do. I would certainly recommend everybody to visit and feel the experience for themselves at least once before getting addicted to their yummy and delicious authentic Burgers, wide range of coffee, mouth-watering Nutella doughnuts, tempting Fajitas and utterly tasty Burritos and many more. If you believe in honoring your belly, do pay a visit to experience the delight.

Modern look, feel and taste without compromising on the charm and hospitality of Nepal. Had the Crispy Chicken and it was tasty as anything I had in the US, maybe even better. Also had the burrito. Delicious, not to mention being able to have an authentic tasting burrito in Nepal is even more exciting. Everything tasted fresh and yummy.
I enjoyed a lovely dinner of Burritos and Burgers with friends. Good service, delicious food and modern atmosphere. I will go back soon.

After coming back from State, this is the first time, I visit Japanese Restaurant with friends and family. When I go inside, all old memories make imagination in my brain about Japanese food. Well we tried lost of food there and sofar so good. Enjoy...More

If you are looking for delicious Japanese food in Kathmandu, Dan Ran is a standout. We particularly like their shrimp tempuras and chicken teriyaki. However the food serving takes longer so make sure you have more to talk about with your family or friends. Seating can be limited so make sure to come early or book to reserve.

I love this restaurant and am surprised it is not already on tripadvisor. I live in the area and this is my go-to spot for date night or lunch with friends. It is the best Japanese food I have had in Nepal, although they do not do raw fish sushi/sashimi. The service is great and the staff are lovely. The spicy chicken set, goma ae salad, agedashi tofu and homemade udon noodles are highly recommended, although I've never had anything here that wasn't delicious. The prawn tempura set is also very tasty. A cozy ambience to sit inside at tables and chairs or in the back room on the floor, Japanese style. Also an outdoor garden that is nice on a sunny winter day but like most of Kathmandu, is a bit dusty. I particularly love the large menu, oddly written in small font and spread out over two giant whiteboards which the staff will set up (or hold) near your table.

column7: If Only I had a bigger stomach to eat MORE!
column8: I’m not kidding! I wish I had more room in my tummy to have eaten more of their delicious food! Settled on the mutton thali and a chatapata salad (refreshing blend of cucumber tomato and other veggies and I nice light dressing of salt vinegar...More

I feel like I can always count on Achaar Ghar to satisfy my spicy food cravings. Have frequented here so often and they ALWAYS get it right. Definitely try: -- Timmur Chiken -- Tingling Fries -- Paneer Palungo -- Chukauni And don't miss our on...More

I liked the decor inside the restaurant, and the veg jhol momo was very good. I don't think exceptional though. They give a sample of the achaar they make on the table in small bowls, which is a good sales technique for their achaar shop below the restaurant.

Upstairs above Standard Charter is a lovely hidden away cafe, very modern decor, newspapers & books for sale. Very helpful staff with great English brings me back again & again. Menu food, lots of coffee choice and a cabinet of cakes etc. Excellent coffee at...More

American style BBQ restaurant with a southern flair in Laliptur district. This is where many Americans live who are residing in Kathmandu. I wanted to try since my last visit to Nepal, but they weren't serving food during the Indian embargo which lasted almost 5...More

column7: Good for western style food in Nepal
column8: Caveat - cooking gas shortage means not all items were available for order including french fries (oil couldn't get hot enough). We were a group of 6 for dinner. After almost two weeks in Nepal we were craving burgers. Though I can't say it was...More

column7: Typical food & service for Restaurant Row
column8: If you live in the area, you know what to expect when dining "Western style" out here. Marginally acceptable food and lonnng waits for service. Southern Comfort is no exception.
