I 120 % recommend pristine Nepal to make your adventure to EBC or other region of Nepal. We where really lucky to met Chin, a great person and very helpful man who makes everything perfect for us and for a very good price. From the pick up to the drop off to the airport was…

column7: Probably the best place for authentic Japanese Udon noodles
column8: This is a very simple place. If you like Japanese Udon, especially the soup style, this is the place to go. They have good 'Takoyaki' too. I always come here alone or with family when I am in the area and in the mood for...More
The chef taught us how to make memos (dumplings) it looks easy when they do it....different when you tried the little tucks and pulls yourself. All was delicious and our servers were outstanding!

column7: Best place for long stay in Kathmandu
column8: Bigfoot is a nice warm home away from home. The owner is very helpful and will go out of his way to make sure you are comfortable at his place. I found the toilets very clean despite being shared by other guests. Excellent kitchen and terrace space to chill. Loved the place and will be back again soon

Everytime we are here in nepal we make sure that we stop and dine on this place. They served good and delicious foods and friendly staff. They also have rooms for rent reasonable price and close to shopping area.

I have stayed a lot where, but this place is special. Feel like at home, not like a hotel. Very hospitable hostess. It’s like you live with friends. Very great view on the roof. Very nice, I will definitely come again.

column7: One week at Patan's Durbar Square
column8: I can't describe how happy I am that I found this place. Umess and his son made everything to make my stay comfortable. To start they made a tour around my room, kitchen and the roof terrace. They showed me all I needed with very clear explanations (needless to say, their English is great). Umess asked me multiple times if I feel comfortable in my room and if I have everything I need. I loved the room. But most I loved the kitchen and the roof top. Umess was offering me snacks and complimentary drinks every time he saw me in the kitchen :) :) I felt so welcomed at his place. Will definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

Every time I feel like a steak out coming on, I head to Grill Me. There's none better in entire Kathmandu. Their steaks are done to perfection. The sauce is amazing, sinfully rich and spiced perfectly. The meat is cooked to the well done as I prefer. And the size of it, well you moan with satisfaction once it's all in you. Most importantly the food is matched by great service and warmth of it's two young owners - Ninesh Tiwari and Anudan Jung Rana.

Went here for a friends birthday. This was my first time eating on and around 'Restaurant Road' in Sanepa, which is where a lot of ex-pats live....and the prices seem to reflect this.  That said, I thought the atmosphere was quite nice and the service was good. I had a fillet steak and was quite pleasantly surprised by the amount of meat that you get for the price, definitely more than you would get ordering the same in a European restaurant.  I'm not sure I could say the steak was of a better quality than another popular steakhouse in Thamel, though it was a bit more expensive. Also vegetarian choices are limited.  We did have a nice evening, but I'm not sure I would come here again

column7: Good interior, average food, poor value
column8: This restaurant looks well designed, specially the bar area. However, the atmosphere seems somewhat bland,that might not be very bad though.  The food is average, not something you expect from a pricey restaurant that boasts of serving some of the best grilled meat in town. A plate of grilled prawn was enough for us, not quantity wise though, as the portion was really small. The accompanying salad seemed like something they prepared for their goats and as an afer thought putit on our plate. The only saving grace was their special salad which was quite good and the portion good.  The live band was good with english songs but it was irritating to hear them trash the Nepali classics with hangover of their english songs, their accent to be precise.  It's expensive, very expensive considering the portion. Overall an average experience.

column7: Truly authentic Japanese restaurant in Kathmandu, Nepal.
column8: There are two Koto Restaurants on Durbar Margh (Kings Way) in Kathmandu and on the same block. It is the most authentic restaurant serving truly traditional Japanese food starting from Karashi ae, Goma ae, Sashimi, Sushi, Tonkatsu set, Sukiyaki set, Ten Zaru Soba to Nabeyaki Soba. The restaurnat is absolutely clean, meals are awesome, ambience is true Japanese with a touch of Nepal. Its best to have a prior reservation instead of turning up for a table. The 3 tables next to the window are my favorite spots. For larger groups they also have traditional Japanese style seating (Tatami) and the bar has good selection of drinks including Sake.
Brilliant Fresh top grade Japanese food in great style & located on the Darbar marg so ideally on the first floor - there lunch box is wonderful if u do not want to get into derails !!

column7: Surprised to find a good japanese restaurant in Kathmandu!
column8: I was really surprised by the food at these place, probably because I went there with really low expectations about Japanese food in Kathmandu, but it was quite suprising! The service was amazing! There is no place that can compare to great staff service in Kathmandu to this place!

column7: Everest Base Camp, Chitwan, Pokhara, Kathmandu and Trekking Guide Team Adventure = perfect adventure of a lifetime. (Ask for gu
column8: We recently returned to the US from the trip of a lifetime in Nepal, organized by Trekking Guide Team Adventure. We started with the Everest Base Camp trek, traveled to Chitwan, then spent a few days in Pokhara. Kabi, the owner and organizer, couldn't have been more professional. He always listened to our wants and needs and always made them happen. He was extremely flexible even when we wanted to change details of our trip on the spot. For example, when going to Chitwan we originally were going to take a tourist bus. We decided we'd rather go by private car(i highly recommend) Kabi arranged us a car and a driver for the entire journey. I can't say enough great things about Kabis professionalism, flexibility, and genuine desire to make our adventure perfect. He succeeded!! Our guide for EBC was Shambu Basnet. This man was one of the main reasons our trip was so enjoyable and successful. He took on several roles on top of being our guide. He arranged for excellent lodging along the trek, made sure our food was wonderful, checked our vitals at high altitude, if we were struggling he was right there to help. He was extremely well knowledgeable and informative regarding the trek, the mountains, the wildlife, and the people and different cultures of Nepal. If you need a guide, you can't do any better than Shambu. I'd trust my life to him any day. He made sure our safety was a number one concern. We were so impressed by Shambu we asked him to join us as our guide after the trek to Chitwan and Pokhara. He graciously accepted and obliged and we are glad he did. Not one part of this trip would have been as enjoyable or educational without Shambu. He too was flexible, if we needed anything...Shambu always went above and beyond to make it happen! We may have started as client and guide but now, thankfully we leave friends forever!!! If you're looking for a trekking or travel agency to help with your trip to Nepal, look no further than Kabi and Trekking Guide Team Adventure. They have a myriad of treks, excursions, and experiences for you to choose from. You won't be disappointed. Kabi, Shambu, and all of the staff at Trekking Guide Team Adventure take customer service to another level. If you're in need of a guide, request Shambu Basnet. Again, you won't be disappointed.

Australian who went with Trekking Guide Team Adventure in December 2019. Kabi was very professional to deal with when booking and when in Nepal as well.  Hotel was much better than expected and was better than many previous hotels I have stayed in.  Krishna was our guide and he was amazing. If it wasn't for him me and my friend would have never gotten to the base camp. He made us feel like family rather than a client. Our porter was also great too.  Would highly recommend as they were a trustworthy and professional company.

I have just returned from the Everest base camp trek and it was best experience ever. Everything went perfectly and according to plan. Our guide Ram was so much fun and clearly managed our expectations in terms of what to expect on the hike. He made us laugh lots and kept our spirits up on the more difficult parts. I couldn’t recommend going through this company enough, everything was planned in advance for us and it made our trip run as smoothly as possible.

What a great trip. Sambu our guide was fantastic, very knowledgeable (I cannot believe how many mountain heights or town altitudes he could remember. The scenery as you expect is superb. However the company came into it's own when I became sick and had to be airlifted back to Kathmandu. They organised everything , including liaising with my insurance agency, meeting me at the hospital and numerous follow up calls and visits.If I do make it back to finish what I started.i will be using this company again

We booked this trip a year before leaving and all communications with Kabi were excellent. We felt completely organised and confident things would go well. When the trek started, our guide Ram handled everything with positivity. His relationships with locals along the trek meant that we were looked after and teahouse experiences exceeded our expectations. His competitive side came out whilst playing board games in the evenings and his dancing ability was on display in more than on

What a fantastic, challenging adventure. 12 days of beautiful scenery mixed in with a tough, challenging 8 day walk up to EBC and 4 days back. Our guide Shambu Basnet and Monoj (porter) were instrumental in helping us achieve our goal. I felt safe and confident in Shambu's military expertise in guiding us up to our destination. Due to weather, we opted to helicopter out of Lukla so were in awe of the speed and efficiency this was organised. I cannot speak highly of Shambu Basnet or Monoj, they were both highly professional in their roles, they both went above and beyond there duties to ensure we had an experience to remember. I'd like to think we gained a new friend. A huge thank you to the "Trekking Guide Adventure Team" who worked with us to make this journey an enjoyable one.

column7: EBC Trek - Amazing Experience and very well organised by Trekking Guide Team Adventure
column8: All I can say is that this trip was amazing!  Trekking Guide Team Adventure organised everything and it all went perfectly. All we did was book and pay and Kabi and his team took care of the rest - all accommodation, domestic flight, bus travel, porters, etc. It couldn't have been easier!  When you arrive into Kathmandu, your are picked up and taken to the accommodation right in the heart of the tourist district 'Thamel' with all the shops/bars/food you could ask for.  The trek itself was a once in a lifetime adventure. We felt so well looked after with private rooms in the tea houses and specialist advice along the way regarding food, staying warm, the region, the wildlife and importantly, altitude sickness.  Special mention to our guide - Krishna Nepal aka Kris - Kris was amazing, friendly, informative and funny. He made the trek to EBC so fun and the long days of walking were made easier with his company and jokes. Many a night were spent playing cards - a definite highlight!  I would recommend Trekking Guide Team Adventure without hesitation - the whole trip went so smoothly without a hitch.  Make sure you book with these guys - and ask for Kris to guide you!

Trekking guide team adventure created an amazing experience for me and my two friends. Kabi is organiser was able to fit our requirements very well. We had a tight schedule but the dates were able to line up perfectly! The guide Shambu made the trip 1000 times better. He is extremely knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions about the history and culture of the mountains. He was very friendly and well connected with the locals meaning he was able to get us rooms when others were sleeping in tents outside. He also knew airport staff and made sure we were able to get higher priority on flights. His priority is always his guests and made sure to always check if we were comfortable. Shambu is the best possible guide you can get and make sure you ask for him when you do this trek!

We were a little apprehensive in booking this trip and wondered whether we were fit enough, both being in our 50's. We found the company (TGTA) to be very professional and experienced and answered all of our questions promptly before setting off. Our main guide Kris has decades of guiding experience and was able to determine the level of attention and care required for each of the 10 trekkers in our group. The trek is arduous and does require a certain level of stamina and fitness to achieve the end goal. We did very limited pre-trek training and would have benefitted from a few weeks or months in the gym (squats and leg strengthening would have been most helpful), nevertheless we endured and conquered. We thoroughly recommend Karbi, Krishna, and the wonderful porters who helped to make our trip enjoyable and memorable. We should also acknowledge the wonderful Nepalese people who are trustworthy, friendly and helpful and reliant on the tourist dollar for their survival. Keep up the good work guys, we hope we can return to your beautiful country someday soon. Best Regards Stuart and Jacque.

column7: EBC Trek plus Lobuche Peak Climb
column8: A very good outfit. Our Trekking guide was Mr RAM. He was absolutely great. All the way along the trek was really made comfortable and the teahouses they use are all good. We were early in the season so did not struggle with space. Ram and our porter even hiked up to the high-camp from where we did the climb the following days. Very importantly they also make sure you are healthy and safe all along the trek.This is something a lot of people tend to oversee/not think about... The company also arrange all the climbing permits and guides, all inclusive. A high recommendation!

I would recommend this visit for singles, couples and families. The professionalism and care shown by all the team was second to none.  Our guide, Shambu Basnet and our porter dham Bahadur Rai went above and beyond expectations during our trip. Shambu has a bank of knowledge about Nepal, from its mountains to its flora and fauna. He taught me some key Nepalise phrases and some traditional card games.  The accommodation was clean and of a high standard. The owners of the tea houses being very kind and welcoming.  Having done minimal training before the trek I was concerned about my potential success to reach EBC but having such a supportive core team made the goal manageable.  Thank you so much team!

column7: Trip of a lifetime! You will not be the same after you hike in the majesty of these mountains!
column8: I traveled in May 2018 with two of my girlfriends to Nepal to do the 16 Day Everest Base Camp trek which we booked with Kabi of Trekking Guide Team Adventure. The service that was provided by this company was Superior! We were met at the airport in Kathmandu, and our transfer to the hotel Thamel with our luggage was very easy. Mr. Kabi came and met us personally, and introduced us to our trekking guide Ram. Ram is a very quality person, and obviously has a passion for his job as a guide. He was patient and caring with 3 women who were complete newbies to the whole trekking experience! He even tried to teach us some Nepalese, although we did not prove to be very good students. Ram was cheerful at all times, and greeted us always with a smile and attended to every detail and need we had during our trek.  We needed to make some changes in our itinerary while we were on the trek, and both Ram and Mr. Kabi worked together to make sure everything worked out for us. They are very concerned with safety, which was a good feeling for 3 women on this adventure.  The Tea Houses we stayed in were certainly adequate, and the food was nourishing and tasted good.  The only thing I would advise is that the trek itself is not as moderate a hike as made out to be. It is very steep a lot of the time, and you are going up stone stairs! I would recommend training yourself for some endurance before you go! Coming down the mountain is just as hard as going up! Be prepared for flight delays in Lukla, and the possibility of needing to take a helicopter out of there as we did if your travel is near to Monsoon season.

We had an amazing trip to Kathmandu and Pokhara and really couldn’t recommend Surya and his team highly enough. Everything was so well organized but also very flexible and it was no problem for us to make a few changes to our itinerary during our trip. We will definitely be back to Nepal and will definitely be contacting Surya!

Always had a wish list of visiting Nepal and trek to the Everest base Camp of the world's tallest mountain. After researching for the best and local trekking company in Kathmandu, Nepal I came across to Nepal Hiking Adventure. I found them were very honest, kind and helpful. I came to Nepal alone but there was a person from the agency who dropped me to my hotel. Later, he took me to his office and I came to know he was my guide for my trip to Everest Base Camp trek. This am a solo travelers but I was requested for group join trek for EBC, NHA has prepared a small group of people from different world, it was a great to meet different people for the trek. We had a small meeting with Bishnu, the managing director and Ram our tour guide. Bishnu brief everything regarding the trip. After that, Ram suggest me best cafes and restaurants nearby my hotel for tasting authentic Nepalese cuisine. Since, I visited Nepal alone they introduce me to wonderful groups of people around as well. Trekking with them was just amazing. We all were visiting Nepal for the first time as well as trekking in Everest but our tour guides and porters make this trip easy, fun, exciting and very memorable. I was truly amazed by our porters Chiring and Lakpa, they were carrying heavy loads of bags on a steep rough pathway whereas we were getting breathless even we were carrying a light backpack.  Throughout the trek, we talk about our personal life stories and learn a lot things about this region. The views from Everest Base camp and Kala Patthar is beyond any imagination which gives you the feelings that Heaven exists in the form of Himalayas. A big thank you to our guide, porters and other Nepal Hiking Adventure team for making my journey everlasting. I will never forget this adventurous journey I took with an amazing group of people. I suggest people to take physical and mental training before starting this trek as it can be very helpful while trekking long distance. I can’t forget this especially at last I would recommend Nepal Hiking Adventure to those who wants best services as this company truly offers high quality services.

column7: A day tour in Kathmandu Valley
column8: I was in Nepal with few friends for few days in our holidays. We found Nepal Hiking Adventure to organize our a day tour in Kathmandu Valley and NHA team organized our a day tour around Kathmandu and they have made our lifetime memorable tour ever. Since we first meet to Bishnu and his team we feel that we are in the right place with right person to organize our tour. The guide Prasant was very professional and informative about everything. He make our day tour is very enjoyable and memorable. Definitely we recommend NHA without any hesitation. If you prefer to book any trip with NHA just go ahead you won’t regret.

column7: Excellent organisation and very enjoyable trip to EBC
column8: It has always been an ambition of ours to walk up to EBC and after some research online we found NHAC.  A prompt detailed email reply from Bishnu (Managing Director) told us that this was the company to go with. After further email exchanges we booked on to a tour and never looked back.  In Kathmandu we were met at the airport by our guide and later we were met by Bishnu in our hotel. He checked our gear and told us what we did and didn't need.  The tour itself was excellent. Zore was a fantastic guide and pointed out all the interesting viewpoints along the way. You see some stunning scenery along the walk. Each day you walk for 4-6 hours over hilly terrain. Some bits are a slog; some bits are thoroughly enjoyable.  Each day you have three meals provided, which are very tasty and very filling! The biggest surprise to us was the accommodation. Each night we stayed in a small hotel and there is the facility to charge your devices, have a hot shower and get wifi. These do have a small cost to them and get more expensive as you go further up the mountain.  We also spent quite a lot on drinks as these are not included in the price. An extra £200 for all of the above should cover you for the duration of the trek. Water is available at every stop but you will need purification tablets to clean the water. This might sound unappealing but it really is fine.  One thing to be mindful of, if you go in the off-season, you might get stuck in Lukla. At the end of a long trek, stinking in your clothes, you 'll want to get out of Lukla and back to the 'comforts' of Kathmandu. We had to charter a helicopter which set us back another $700 but Bishnu did return us the cost of the flight as this was cancelled. This is your choice as the flights are often cancelled during this time of year. There was a guy in our hotel cabin who had been there EIGHT days waiting for a flight. Didn't quite fancy that...  Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed the trip and Bishnu helped to make it as simple and easy as possible. He provided us with a letter to send off to our insurance company too because of the cancelled flight.  Thank you Bishnu and NHAC!

Overall a second trip with a company that had a few positives but an astounding anoint of negatives  Pre-Tour - great response time and attention to all of our questions from Bishnu - well arranged pickup logistics - excellent support to retrieve coat left on plane - briefing prior to tour departure was not thorough (no discussion on weight for baggage, oxygen measuring, potential health issues, need for crampons or warning of the ice/how to handle the ice on Chola Pass)  Tour Customer Service - Guide (Kamal) focussed on myself a repeat client saying "you're the client and M is just there" several times. After this I spoke to Kamal and said please do not speak about M like this. He said "actually yes I should focus on him and not you as you've already come back", I said "no you need to treat us equally". However from this time onwards the entire focus was on M, to the point of isolating me out of the group - I was the inconvenient woman on the boys trip  Itinerary After loosing the first porter to illness Kamal was forced to carry all the bags (~37kg) on his own for a day - we said we would provide feedback to the company that he should be compensated. We were told that the problem was caused by us choosing to walk from Salleri - we said we followed Bishnu's advice and we cannot be held responsible for the fact that porters can't be found at Salleri.  Later in Gokio I was told there was not enough time to climb Gokio Ri in the itinerary because not enough time had been left to return to Lukla & because I was too slow - why did Bishnu create an itinerary that was not achievable I asked Kamal - he said again it was because we choose to walk from Salleri - do you think anyone could give some sensible advice from this company on what to do on a planning a trek? As for being too slow Chola Pass - Kamal's estimate 10-12hrs - my time 8.5hr; Crossing Gokyo glacier Kamal's estimate 3-4hrs - my time 2.5hrs. I could continue but the reality was being a boring woman I didn't stand a chance of arguing this.  Baggage Kamal had told us in Kathmandu on the morning of departure our bags could not be more than 15kg/person. We borrowed the hotel scales and ensured we met this regulation. The new porter (Kishore) was told by Kamal that the bags were between 26-28kg combined. Kishore complained within a day that the bags were too heavy. Kamal asked us to remove our items from the bags to reduce the weight. We said we were told 15kg in Kathmandu by himself and it's not our fault that he had told the porter a lower number and if he needed to pay more to the porter that was his issue to resolve not ours. We certainly couldn't be expected to throw our personal effects away. On the Chola Pass Kishore had less than 15kg to carry and offered to carry my backpack - taking his load to 20kg. After 10min he dropped my bags and again complained about the weight -  Roles We observed Kamal calling the porters "Assistant Guide" and asking them to do tasks of a guide - we provided feedback to the company that you cannot call someone by a higher title than they are being paid  Drinking The first of several drunken episodes with Kamal - he informed us that he was a very busy man in Kathmandu and had cancelled his training to take our tour. We were told this multiple times and our response was consistently - if you weren't free you should have told Bishnu because we did not specify who should guide us. Upon returning to Kathmandu we checked with the company on this and were told he had confirmed he was free to take the trip. I asked Ram was this to get a better tip? - and he laughed. We never mentioned tips or that there would not be a tip. Where the need to be manipulative and deceitful came from is a complete shock.  Kamal was drunk on a number of evenings. He was more focussed on playing cards, expressing how boring the trip was for him, telling clients to go to bed early (in retrospect that seemed odd to be sent to bed soon after dinner) and commenting on Japanese women. It is not the clients job to entertain the guide and to be continuously told how bored he was - offensive is all that can be said. The height of his issues with alcohol was at Gokyo - the eve of climbing Gokyo Ri I was trying to express I was scared, I could not breath and had not slept. He was so drunk he said to another tourist that Choyong was the highest mountain in the world. He could not be reasoned with nor could he help with the issues I faced. The owners of the Fitzroy Inn (excellent and worth the extra $) also confirmed he had been drinking all afternoon. On communicating this to Bishnu he said he had no idea where this behaviour had come from. Back in Kathmandu speaking to Ram he admitted the company was aware of previous issues. How an organisation can know such information, pretend they don't know and endanger people's lives at altitude is beyond comprehension.  Harassment "Chinese Food, Italian Suit, American Life, Japanese Wife" - "Japanese girls eh eh eh??" I expressed disappointment at Kamal speaking about women in this way. This continued throughout the trip and was even said to a Japanese woman’s face. I understand in this culture similar to my Indian culture - women are not valued. However, when you have international clients where #metoo #timesup is at its height – time to educate yourself Bishnu - it is never acceptable for your staff to speak about women in this way.  The night before reaching Lukla a drunk Kamal and sober Kishore ganged up on me at dinner and said "tomorrow is the last day and porter wants you to know that you have to give a tip. Of course it's your choice but really you have to give a tip." Next morning I told Kamal I have never been spoken to in that way and Kamal said it was his first time a porter has behaved in this way. I responded "it's not however your first time for getting drunk". At Lukla both were told there would be no tip - if I was white or a man no one would dare to speak to me in this way nor would they dare to speak to me drunk. I had to lock myself in my room in Lukla. Bushnu did intervene and I did appreciate that however what he said was that we could discuss everything in Kathmandu, knowing full well he would not be in Kathmandu.  Customer Service Imn fact at the same time he was sitting with my friend (who had evacuated out) at dinner saying he was leaving the next morning to (“check accommodations for upcoming groups of about 20 pax“) as it was almost 2 years since he'd been on the mountain. How can you be in this business and not visit at least yearly? On return to Kathmandu Ram was sent (Bishnu did not admit he was not in Kathmandu or even apologise for not being present until I complained that “clearly as I wouldnt be returning as a client he sees no need to face me and hear any of this”) Ram's response was you've been through a terrible experience and I would have reacted like you to the demand for a tip but please don't put any of this on TripAdvisor. Really? I don't think that it is any organisations gift to ask for. Especially if they do not offer any kind of compensation until challenged and then it's a series of complaints that Kamal did his job by bringing me back to Kathmandu and just because the porter wants a tip and the guide is drunk I want to ruin Bishnu’s company. Seriously I have better things to do and it is irrelevant to me what actions you have taken against the guide – feedback good or bad needs to be accepted particularly if you do not have do not have have the decency to stick around to hear the feedback .

Three of us booked our own tour to EBC in February 2018. Months before the trip, Bishnu communicated with us clearly and efficiently to answer all of our questions and let us personalize the trip a bit. Upon arrival, we met our guide Ram, who is the reason we made it all the way up to Base Camp and back down safely! We stayed in tea houses that were much nicer than we ever imagined, and the food at all these places was great! We did not know what kind of quality to expect in the mountains, but Nepal Hiking Adventure Company took good care of us. We had to helicopter down a couple days early due to AMS, and they accommodated us by giving us a city tour while we were still in Kathmandu. I would HIGHLY recommend this company to anyone wishing to see Nepal and the surrounding mountains! It's safe, reliable, and fun! :)

column7: Day Tour of Patan and Bhaktapur
column8: Well organized and reasonably paced tour of the two great places at once, most recommended for those travellers who are time constrained and would like to make it all in one day. The tour guide and driver (both local) were very professional. The tour guide’s details were promptly provided by the office on my request a day in advance, for piece of mind for the morning pick up at the hotel - although I ended up never using those, as the guide was there ahead of time, waiting for me in the lobby. The vehicle was proper and clean. Also, I happened to be the only booked tourist on that day, so I got a private tour for no extra price. Good experience overall, thanks again to the company and the tour crew for supporting that day adventure!

It is hard to find companies that really care about the expectations of the guests, specially when the format of the tour is already designed. I’m very grateful because, I received a great service, flexible and helpful, understanding that it was my first time in Nepal, and the complications of the weather. The owner of the agency, totally made me feel at home and the guide (Paras) definitely loves his country and his job. Patan is a breathtaking place and Nepal a great country to visit full of king people. I will definitely come back for the Sagarmatha treaking. Thanks a lot
Worth it visit. It didn’t feel like it was first time. Guide explained the surrounding in excellent way. Thank you for making our trip fun. Highly recommended.
